loans.use: to purchase a computerized embroidery machine to develop her sewing business

loans.name: Shaodat

texts.en:
Shaodat is a woman who tries to do the best for the educational system of Tajikistan. She is a teacher of history. She teaches the Tajik history and world history for students. She is smart and a highly educated woman. Shaodat has worked for more than 40 years. She has great experience and knows all types of information. 

She is widow. Her husband died in 1999. She raised her children alone. Nowadays she lives with her three children in a little flat. She bought land for building a house some years ago and now she wants to build a big house for her big family. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy building materials such brick, cement, soil, etc. for building a house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such brick, cement, soil, etc. for building a house

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo, 47 years of age, wishes to have a progressive way of living and successful business someday. He cultivates and grows rice within his locality. According to him, he has managed his rice field for 18 years. Through this kind of business, he was able to help his wife in providing for their children's needs.

Danilo would like to request a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. He hopes to obtain this amount of loan so he could supply all farm inputs needed to his rice field. In this way, he could probably grow better crops and have a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for his farming business

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. Two of them are adults and two of them are non-adults. Her husband is a driver. Munira is going to start her own business by selling food items. She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead,’ through a women's organization and got a certificate. She needs your financial support. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 TJS to buy a fridge, showcase and other items to open a food shop. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a fridge, showcase and other items to open a food shop

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 58 years old and engaged in a farming business. He has operated his rice farm for over 27 years. Wilson's primary source of income comes mainly from his farming business.

Wilson would like to complete the farm inputs needed to his rice field, but due to the high cost of basic commodities and farm inputs, he suffers from financial difficulties.This led him to ask for a loan of PHP 20,000. This amount of loan will be use to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide.

He knows this additional capital would be a great factor in improving his rice field. 

He hopes that he could harvest enough profit for the betterment of his business and their general way of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, fungicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Danelene

texts.en: Danelene is 25 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Danelene has borrowed and repaid four prior loans from NWTF, has been running her general store for two years and supplements her income by selling clothing. Her goal for the future is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 20 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emma has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. Emma has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 57 years old and married with three children. Evelyn has a tailoring business in the Philippines; she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

Evelyn has been in this business for ten years.  In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 31 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. 

Judy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Judy requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 51 years old and married with one kid.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as soft drinks, noodles, and other groceries.

Lolita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Lolita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft drinks, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Roselyn works hard to support her family. She earns a living by selling used clothing in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more used clothing to sell. Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of being able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Adriana Marcela

texts.es:
Adriana es una persona que quiere estudiar porque se quiere superar, ya que debido a su bajo nivel de estudio y por su edad se le han cerrado muchas puertas laboral y personalmente. Para ella es muy importante mejorar su calidad de vida ya que por ser madre cabeza de hogar con 2 hijos; no le ha alcanzado el dinero para estudiar y las pocas veces que ha intentado hacerlo debe retirarse por cuestiones de dinero, por que le es difícil mantener a su familia ganando el mínimo.

Adriana vive con sus hijos y con su mamá a la cual ha tenido que mantener desde los 15 años debido a que ella sufrió una enfermedad que la hizo perder la memoria y no es apta para trabajar, por lo tanto a Adriana lo poco que gana le alcanza para los gastos básicos de su hogar; debe pagar arriendo, servicios y los gastos de las 3 personas que tiene a su cargo. Ella tiene muchas expectativas con esta carrera porque le gusta mucho el tema de la criminalística y le apasiona, y aunque no es una carrera profesional, se ha dado cuenta que los técnicos también son valorados a nivel empresarial y que no debe dejar pasar las oportunidades que la vida le da en este momento.
texts.en:
Adriana is a person who wants to study so that she can succeed in life, because due to her low level of education and her age she has been shut off from many opportunities, both work-related and personal.  For her, improving her quality of life is very important, because she is the head of household for her family of 2 children.  She has not had enough money to study, and the few times she has tried she's had to withdraw due to a lack of funds, as it is difficult to support her family while earning the minimum.

Adriana lives with her children and with her mother.  She's had to support her mother for 15 years, because she suffered from an illness that made her lose her memory, and so she has not been fit to work.  Therefore, the little that Adriana earns has been needed to pay for the basic household expenses, such as rent, utilities, and the expenses of her 3 dependents.

Adriana has high expectations for this degree, because she really enjoys the subject of criminology and is passionate about it.  Even though this is not a professional degree, she realizes that technicians are also valued at the enterprise level, and she doesn't want to pass up the opportunities that life is presenting her with at this time.

loans.use: to pay for technical vocational education expenses

loans.name: Diana Mireya

texts.es:
Diana es una estudiante que actualmente se esfuerza por salir adelante para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus dos hijos; ya que en su infancia tuvo que lidiar con la separación de sus padres y la convivencia con su hermano mayor, quien desde muy chico conoció a dos amigos, los cuales lo llevaron a ser un delincuente y obrar de mala fe con la sociedad, él, robaba y llego a tal punto que probo y se dejo consumir por el efecto de los alucinógenos. 

Con el pasar de los años Diana distinguió a un joven que tenía más edad que ella; del cual quedo embarazada y quien la abandonó sin importar la suerte que correría este pequeño. Luego como medio para salir adelante, ella consiguió un trabajo en ayuda de un conocido para vender frutas en calles de la ciudad, de esta manera ella le colaboraba económicamente en los gastos a su madre y suplía las necesidades básicas de su hijo, allí conoció a otro joven con el que se fue a vivir y tuvo a su segundo hijo, quien al cabo de un tiempo empezó a agredirla tanto física como verbalmente, es por esto que Diana decidió salir de aquel inquilinato y dejarlo solo, consiguió un empleo en una panadería donde actualmente trabaja, cuida de sus hijos y paga su estudio con esfuerzo y gran dedicación. 

La visión de ella es obtener un titulo profesional que le dé garantías de una estabilidad 

laboral, para brindarles un futuro digno a sus hijos y una casa propia para compartir en 

familia.
texts.en: Diana is a student who is working to get ahead and to improve the quality of life for her and her children.  In her childhood, she had to deal with the separation of her parents, and with living with her older brother.  When he was very young, her brother met 2 friends who led him into being a criminal who led a deceitful, antisocial lifestyle.  He stole, and then got to the point where he tried, and then allowed his life to be destroyed by, hallucinogenic drugs. Years later, Diana met a young man who was older than she was, and became pregnant by him.  He then abandoned her, without any concern for the fate of the child.  Later, in order to get ahead, she took a job helping an acquaintance sell fruit in the streets of the city.  In this way she was able to help her mother pay the bills and to support her child.  She then met another young man, with whom she began living and had a second child.  However, after a while he began to abuse her physically and verbally, so Diana decided to leave their home.  She found a job in the bakery where she now works, takes care of her children, and studies with great effort and dedication. Her vision is to obtain a professional degree that will guarantee her job stability, in order to provide her children with a good future and a home to share with her family.

loans.use: to complete her technical work training.

loans.name: Sofia Ivania

texts.es:
Sofía, disfruta de su familia la cual está integrada por su esposo y su hija, vive junto a ellos, se dedica a elaborar panes con pollo, pupusas y comida, ya tiene mucho tiempo con su negocio, lo atiende sola en algunas veces su esposo la apoya, por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en atenderlo.
Con el crédito comprara carnes, embutidos, verduras, condimentos, bebidas, gas propano, etc., todo lo necesario para preparar los diferentes tipos de alimentos que vende. Con esto espera tener un negocio más competitivo, aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su economía.
Sueña con tener los ingresos necesarios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, darle la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior a su hija.
texts.en:
Sofía is so happy to have her family, which is made up of her husband and their daughter. She lives with them. She works making panes con pollo (a type of Salvadoran filled bread with chicken and vegetables), pupusas (filled corn tortillas) and other foods. She has had her business for a long time and takes care of it herself. Sometimes her husband helps her, and so far she has had no problems attending to the business.

She will use the loan to buy meats, sausages, vegetables, condiments, drinks, propane gas, etc.; all the necessary items for preparing the different foods she sells. With this, she hopes to have a more competitive business, increase her sales, and improve her finances. She dreams of making enough income to improve her family's quality of life and to give her daughter the opportunity to study a higher education degree.

loans.use: to buy meats, sausages, vegetables, condiments, drinks, and propane gas

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, es casado, tiene tres hijos de 16, 11 y 5 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, Es alguien lucha día con día para llevar el sustento a su hogar y que a su familia no le falte nada. Se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, es una actividad que aprendió de sus padres, trabaja de 6:00 a.m. hasta bien tarde.
Solicita capital para pagar la mano de obra que le ayudara a recolectar la cosecha, espera recolectar la cosecha a tiempo para cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes a tiempo, así sus ganancias serán efectivas con mucha rapidez y su economía será estable.
Sueña con ampliar el área de siembra, aumentar las ventas y que sus ingresos aumenten, con lo que espera  mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is married and has three children aged 16, 11, and 5. He lives with his wife and children. He is a person who fights day after day to put food on the table and make sure that his family has everything they need. He plants basic grains, work he learned from his parents, and works from 6:00 AM until quite late.

He requests capital to pay for hired labor to help him bring in the harvest. He hopes to bring it in on time so he can fulfill his clients' orders on time. In this way his earnings will come in very quickly and his finances will be stable. He dreams of increasing his planting area, selling more, and increasing his income, with which he hopes to improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for hired labor to help him collect the harvest

loans.name: Martin De Jesus

texts.es:
Martin, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su mamá y sus dos hermanos de 15 y 12 años. Desde hace cinco años se dedica a cultivar maíz, trabaja de lunes a sábado con sus hermanos, en el tiempo que tiene ejerciendo esta actividad no ha tenido ningún problema para realizarla.
Con la inversión comprara abono semilla, fertilizante, plaguicidas y pagara el alquiler del terreno, con esta oportunidad de capital espera aumentar la producción, tener más ganancias, y salir de la deuda.
Aspira a tener un negocio mucho más amplio, mejorar su economía, apoyar a su mamá con los gastos se hogar, ya que su padre falleció y por esa razón él y su madre son los encargados de cubrir gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Martin is 22 years old and sigle. He lives with his mother and two brothers, who are ages fifteen and twelve. He has been growing corn for five years. He works Monday through Saturday with his brothers. For as long as he has been in this business he has not run into any problems.

He will use this investment to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides, and to pay rent on the land he farms. He expects this opportunity will allow him to increase production, make more profit, and get out of debt. 

He aspires to have a much larger business, improve his finances, and help his mother with household expenses, since his father passed away and, because of this, he and his mother are in charge of covering the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides, and to pay rent.

loans.name: Munazza

texts.en:
Munazza is a 35-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

To earn a living, for many years, with the help of her daughter, she has been knitting sacks at her home. Her husband then sells her products in the market. Her husband's income is irregular, so she has to be a responsible and brave mother. She has worked hard to attain a regular list of customers and to generate enough income to help support her family.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Munazza has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of raw materials (e.g., threads). She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials (e.g., threads) for her knitting business.

loans.name: Mohsum

texts.en: Mohsum, 37, lives with his wife and two children. His wife stays at home and takes care of their family. Mohsum started his taxi business in town, after he got his driver's license. He is now an experienced driver and is planning on replacing his car with a better one before it loses value on the market. He is a hardworking, diligent and reliable man and is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN to add a bathroom to his house.

loans.use: to add a bathroom to his house.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a youth living in Sinai, a part of Mukuru's informal settlements in Nairobi. He has a passion for business, and desires to endeavour in this area which is turning out to be explored by more youth in the country today. 

He currently owns an m-pesa shop, which is a mobile money service. He recently learned about the Fresh Life Initiative, and thought of it as a good investment opportunity. However, he has not been able to raise enough capital to start the venture. 

He therefore seeks funding to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. 

He aims to use the profits that the business will generate to expand and be a part of the solution to the problem posed by poor sanitation.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
João, casado, pai de 4 filhos, dos quais apenas 3 é que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua mãe que vive noutra casa. 
É comerciante (vende cerveja, vinho, bolachas, óleo outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de cinco anos. Também é Carpinteiro de profissão, a sua esposa apoia na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos ampliar o seu negócio e progredir profissionalmente. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
João is married, the father of 4 children - only 3 of whom go to school - and lives in a house he owns. In addition to his family, he also supports his mother who lives in another house.

He's been a trader (selling beer, wine, cookies, oil and other basic products) for more than 5 years. He's also a carpenter by profession and his wife supports him in his commercial activities.

With the current loan of 10,000.00 MZN he plans to buy more products so he can respond to demand and reinforce his stock.
He dreams of expanding his business and growing professionally. His main challenge is a lack of funds to invest in his business.

loans.use: buy more products so he can respond to demand and reinforce his stock.

loans.name: Maulito

texts.pt:
Mautilio, casado, pai de 4 filhos, somente um é que frequenta escola e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família não sustenta a ninguém. 
É comerciante (vende sumos, óleo, pastilhas, folha de chá, refrigerantes e outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de dez anos. A sua esposa apoia na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 8.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos comerciais para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock a fim de garantir a credibilidade no mercado.
Tem como sonhos ampliar o seu negócio e construir um estabelecimento comercial aliviando-se do mercado móvel. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
Mautilio is married, the father of 4 children - only 1 of whom goes to school - and lives in a house he owns. He doesn't support anyone other than his family.

He's been a trader (selling juices, oil, tablets, tea leaves, sodas and other basic products) for more than ten years. His wife supports him in his commercial activity.

With this loan for 8,000.00 MZN he plans to buy more products to be able to respond to demand and reinforce his stock in order to gain credibility in the marketplace.

He dreams of expanding his business and building a commercial establish so he can move away from traveling sales. His main challenge is the lack of funds to invest in his business.

loans.use: buy more products (juices, oil, tea leaves, sodas and other basic products) to be able to respond to demand and reinforce his stock

loans.name: Salva

texts.pt:
Salva, casada, mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais somente é que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Não tem dependentes para além da sua família. 
É comerciante (vende vinagre, sal de cozinha, cebolas, batata reno e outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de dez anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos comerciais para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos melhorar as condições de habitação, financiar os estudos dos seus filhos e melhorar a dieta alimentar do agregado familiar. Tem como principais desafios a falta de fundos para investir, incrementar seu fundo de maneio e para melhorar a dieta alimentar.
texts.en:
Salva is married, the mother of 5 children - of whom only 2 go to school - and lives in a house she owns. She doesn't have any dependents aside from her family.

She has been a trader (selling vinagre, kitchen salt, onions, potatoes and other basic products) for more than ten years.

With this loan for 15,000.00 MZN she plans to buy more products to respond to demand and reinforce her stock.

She dreams of improving her living conditions, paying for her children's education and improving her family's diet. Her main challenges are the lack of funds to invest and increasing her working capital to improve the diet.

loans.use: buy more products (selling vinagre, kitchen salt, onions, potatoes and other basic products) to respond to demand and reinforce her stock.

loans.name: Hilda Yaneth

texts.es: La señora Hilda Yaneth quien se dedica a la confección de blusas de tela para damas, junto al lado de su esposo que la a apoyado en su negocio, nuevamente se ven en la necesidad de solicitar otro crédito. Se aproximan las fechas navideñas y ella como comerciante inicia a prepararse para la compra de tela por rollo que es la inversión más grande que tiene la compra de la tela. Los pedidos por parte de sus compradores empiezan a llegar y le hace falta tela para poder surtir las blusas en colores y estilos. El capital que tiene no le alcanza y por ello se ven en la necesidad de mas capital para no quedarle mal a sus clientes, ella tiene ya varios años de tener creditos en kiva y no a quedado en mora y es una buena persona que lucha dia a dia para salir en su negocio.
texts.en: Hilda Yaneth works sewing blouses for women along with her husband, who has supported her in her business. Once again, they need to request a new loan. The Christmas holidays are near and, as a retailer, she is starting to prepare to buy rolls of fabric, and purchasing fabric is her largest investment. Her customers' orders are starting to arrive and she needs fabric in order to make blouses in a variety of styles and colors. The capital she has is not enough, which is why they need more capital in order not to let their customers down. She has received Kiva loans for several years now and has never been delinquent. She is a good person who strives day by day to keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make women's clothing.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Mohy

texts.en:
Mohy is a kind woman. She has not had higher education. Mohy always wanted to get higher education, but she has not had the opportunity. She has worked for more than 20 years as rental worker in different places. 

She has three children. Her husband is an electrician. Mohy is working as a seller in the local market now. Mohy and her husband have a little income. They live together in a flat which is in bad condition. She wants to repair her flat, but she does not have enough money to buy building materials such as paint, wallpaper, cement, etc. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni with this aim. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such paint, wallpaper, and cement for repairing her flat

loans.name: Jaguar Group

texts.en:
Hamadi is in his late 50s, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school and two of whom have finished school.  He operates two businesses, a retail shop and charcoal selling, which he has been doing for three years.  He works from 7 AM to 9 PM daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

Hamadi is requesting his fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to restock missing items in the shop inventory.  He used the previous loans to increase the shop inventory and started selling charcoal.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, cover household expenses, and build his own house. He dreams of owning a wholesale shop.

Hamadi will share this loan with his loan group, Jaguar, which consists of 10 members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock missing items in the shop inventory.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 39-year-old married man from a refugee camp near Ramallah city. He is a father for four sons and one daughter; all of them are under ten years old. Samer owns a small cafeteria at a local firm. It has been open for fifteen years. He makes lights sandwiches and soft drinks, and sells them to the employees and workers there. It is a good business and earns a good income, but Samer would like to develop his cafeteria.
 
Samer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy more products and tools for his cafeteria. This will improve his income and the family's living conditions.
 
Samer would like to provide a good education level for his children to enter the university. 
Samer appears in the photo while he is working in his cafeteria.

loans.use: to buy more products and tools for his cafeteria.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en: Eliud is 64 years old and from Nakuru. He is married to Jane and all their children are adults. He is a pharmacist. He has been running his pharmacy business for the last three years. He would like to diversify his sources of income, and will use the requested loan to buy a motorcycle. Eliud's monthly income right now is KES 20,000. He plans of using the anticipated profits from his expanded business to buy more medicine to sell to his customers at his pharmacy. He hopes for a successful future for his business and family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a 46-year-old married mother with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Liberty has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Liberty has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 24 years old, married, and has two children. 

Marjorie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marjorie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marjorie would like to save money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is married and she works hard to support her family. She makes and sells ice candy in the Philippines. 

Socorro is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice candy business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Meet Ronald, a farmer living in Nyamira, a popular banana-growing area. He is married and has three children, all of whom are still depending on him for their upkeep. He has been an active farmer for 10 years, where he produces and sells milk, tea, eggs, and bananas. He said that he enjoys farming because it has good returns if one puts a lot of effort into it, though it is quite challenging, especially in terms of funding the the projects in the farm.

Ronald chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer reasonable interest rates on their loans. He says that microfinance does help small-scale farmers to uplift their standards of living. Through this loan, he will be able to support his family financially and give them a better living environment.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Mellen is a 42-year-old farmer living in Nyamira. She is married, and has five children; she has been involved in active farming for eight years.  This is where her family gets its source of livelihood. 

Her main sources of income are milk, eggs, tea, and bananas. She enjoys mixed farming because it gives her a good income.The challenges she faces are limited funds and a limited supply of water.

She chose Juhudi Kilimo because they have better services, and she will be able to purchase a water tank that will help her irrigate her crops and provide drinking water for her livestock. She says that mfis (microfinance institutions) help uplift the living standards of small scale farmers.

This loan will help her provide for her family and also pay school fees for the children.

Juhudi Kilimo has made her a better farmer.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 38 years old and married, with six children.

Diana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Diana has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for two years now, and she also earns an income from food vending.

Diana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old and married, with six children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Twelve years ago he decided to trade in newspapers after checking the demand in his town. With the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land for farming.

Rain and inadequate capital to rent a business premises affect his returns, since he operates out in the open.  He desires to become a major distributor of the most-read newspaper, to rent a decent premises for his business, and to build a good house for his residence.

Joseph intends to use the loan to buy bricks and cement for construction.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement for construction.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo appreciates the previous loan that enabled her to improve her charcoal selling business. From the loan, she managed to get profits she used to open a business selling lessos (women's wrap clothes). 

She is requesting a loan of ksh.15,000 to purchase pieces of women wrap clothes to sell.

She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of women wrap clothes to sell.

loans.name: Guadalupe Cristina

texts.es:
Guadalupe, es una señora que ha luchado para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, es madre de cuatro hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive junto a uno de ellos. Debido a la necesidad de obtener ingresos para cubrir los gatos de su casa, empezó a vender ropa, y accesorios de belleza, su recorrido lo hace en las comunidades cercanas a su residencia. Con la experiencia que tiene en el negocio ha evitado todo tipo de dificultad.
Con la inversión comprara camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas, pulceras, aretes y anillos. Le ayudara a tener un inventario surtido para estas épocas de fin de año, aumentara sus ventas, mejorara su economía y cancelara su deuda.
Anhela ampliar su negocio para tener la capacidad de mejorar la alimentación y salud de su casa así como también seguir ampliando el negocio para conservar su independencia
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a woman who has worked hard to support her children. She is the mother of four children, who are now independent. She lives together with one of them. Due to the need to obtain income to cover her household expenses, she began to sell clothing and beauty accessories. She makes her rounds in the communities near her home. Thanks to her experience with the business, she has been able to avoid any kind of difficulty. 

With the investment she will buy shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, bracelets, rings and earrings. This will help her to have a well-stocked inventory for the end-of-year season, and thus increase her sales, improve her earnings and allow her to pay her debt. 

She would like to expand her business in order to be able to improve her family's nutrition and health, as well as to continue expanding her business to preserve her independence.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, bracelets, rings and earrings.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is hard-working and enterprising, the widowed mother of four children, who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

Fatuma prepares dumplings using sugar, cooking oil, and wheat flour and sells them to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase more wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en: Tasleem is 53 years old and married. She does not have much money, and needs to think very carefully about how to use the funds she does have. Her son earns a living by driving a motor rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw-motorbike), which is good for use on local roads and for short distances. Its body is made of polyester and is not strong enough to bear the stress of travel on faster roads. She is requesting this loan to help her son buy a new rickshaw body to replace the current one, which rattles when driven. Tasleem is grateful for the help she and her son are receiving from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a motor rikshaw for her son.

loans.name: Noreeen

texts.en:
Noreeen is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children: two daughters and a son. She is striving hard to support them, which includes providing food, clothing, and health care. Her husband is employed in a small factory, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 
She started her business sewing clothes to contribute to the family income, and she is well familiar with stitching techniques. She requested a loan to buy a new stitching machine, along with some spools of threads, cloths, buttons, and needles, so she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, along with some spools of threads, cloths, buttons, and needles for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is 45 years old and a responsible mother.  She is living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her sixth loan with the BRAC and first with the Kiva. 

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scraps such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the people and sell it to the recycling factories. 

Nowadays due to household expenses, he does not have enough to buy scrap goods and thus does not have enough scrap to sell for getting money.
Therefore, Rubina has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy more scraps, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more scrap goods such as iron, aluminum, copper, and plastic for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Orfa Group

texts.es:
DUO ORFA
Este dúo formado por doña María Dalí, es soltera y es dueña de una tienda ubicada en su casa desde hace 6 años, además como actividad secundaria ella vende ropa típica dos días a la semana y con eso se ayuda para mantenerse, ella solicita este crédito para invertir en sus negocios comprando más productos en su tienda ( golosinas, comida enlatada, aceite, aguas, maíz, frijol, etc.), también comprar ropa blusas, y delantales que es lo que más vende. Y ahora que viene la temporada de fin de año hay muy buena venta, esperando que nuevamente le puedan ayudar en su negocio ya que en el primer credito fue muy puntual.
texts.en:
This group, Duo Orfa, was founded by María Dalí. She is single and has been the owner of a store located in her home for six years. As a supplemental business, she also sells traditional clothing two days per week, which helps her support herself. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in her businesses by purchasing more products for her store (candy, canned food, oil, drinks, corn, beans, etc.) and also to purchase clothing: blouses and aprons, which are her best-selling items. And now that the end of the year is near, sales are very good. 

She hopes to again get help for her business, because she was prompt in paying off her first loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Elizabeth

texts.es: Blanca de 32 años de edad se encuentra acompañada y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijas de 15 años, 12 años y 6 años de edad. Blanca es una mujer caracterizada por su emprendedurismo ya que busca las oportunidades del mercado para sacarles el mejor provecho. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer un pequeño taller de costura en el cual elabora variedad de prendas de acuerdo a los requerimientos de sus clientes. Además, posee una venta de licuados de frutas frescas los cuales son muy demandados por sus clientes. Desea invertir en sus negocios con el propósito de incrementar sus ingresos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para hacer la inversión y comprar variedad de telas, hilos, etc. para el taller de costuras, así como variedad de frutas, azúcar y leche para la venta de los deliciosos licuados.
texts.en: Blanca is 32 years old and has a life partner. She lives in her own house together with her daughters, who are 15, 12 and 6 years old. Blanca is a woman known for her entrepreneurial spirit, since she seeks market opportunities in order to get the most out of them. With great effort, she has succeeded in establishing a small tailoring workshop, where she creates a variety of garments in accordance with her customers' needs. In addition, she has a sales stand for fresh fruit smoothies, which are in great demand among her customers. She would like to invest in her businesses, with the aim of increasing her income. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to make this investment and buy a variety of fabrics, thread, etc., for her tailoring workshop, as well as millk, sugar and a variety of fruits for the preparation and sale of her delicious smoothies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics and thread for her tailoring workshop, as well as fruit, sugar and milk to make smoothies to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es: María de 42  años de edad, es madre soltera y habita junto a su madre de 84 años y sus tres hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer en su hogar de residencia. Vende variedad de productos tales como bebidas gaseosas, golosinas, cereales, aceite, jabón, etc. Con el deseo de mejorar sus ingresos y poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de un mayor inventario para su tienda como: cereales, golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, pan dulce, aceite, jabón, etc. Tiene plena confianza que con los ingresos que percibe logrará pagar las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and is a single mother to her three children. She lives with her children and her elderly mother, who is 84 years old. María makes a living running a convenience store out of her home and selling products for daily consumption, including: soft drinks, cereal, sweets, oil, soap, etc. 

With the support from this loan, María plans to purchase merchandise to stock her store, including: cereal, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, oil, soap, etc. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen her business, and she promises to make all scheduled loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, sweets, soft drinks, pastries, oil, soap, etc. to stock her convenience store.

loans.name: Norayda

texts.en:
Norayda is a 50-year-old married mother with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Norayda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Norayda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 38 years old and married with three children.

Pamela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Pamela has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Pamela aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married and she works hard to support her family.

She runs a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like rice, sugar, soft drinks, and school supplies.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, sugar, soft drinks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena is 55 years old and a married mother of four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Serena earns a living selling dried fish in the Philippines. Serena requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Serena has been in this business for two years. In the future, Serena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lanie works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Lanie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional tailoring materials like chunk (material scraps used to make rags, etc..), linen, threads, etc for her tailoring business.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional tailoring materials like chunk, linen, threads, etc

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from house rental.  

Teresita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 37-years-old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marivic is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marivic has been farming rice for seventeen years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nyakasanga Women Group

texts.en: Betty is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Thirteen years ago she decided to venture into tailoring services and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children.  Her major clients are schools and hospital staff.  Her desire is to own at least six sewing machines, since the demand is high, and hire other people to help her in her work. She is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.  Betty intends to use the loan to buy a sewing machine to use.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to use.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Angeline has been in this business for one year. Angeline earns more income from fish vending.

Angeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es:
Juan, necesita capital para recolectar la cosecha de granos básicos, con el préstamo pagara mano de obra, transporte para trasladarlo a su casa y una maquina desgranadora para procesar el maíz.
Con el crédito anterior tuvo una mayor producción, mejores ganancias con las que cancelo el crédito y mejoro sus condiciones de vida. Sigue trabajando para ampliar cada vez más el negocio.
texts.en:
Juan needs funds to harvest his crop of staple grains. He will use the loan to pay for labor, the cost of transporting the crop to his house, and a threshing machine to process the corn.

With the previous loan he was able to increase his production and his earnings with which he paid off the loan and improved his living conditions. He continues working to keep expanding his business.

loans.use: to pay for labor and transport.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with six children.  One child is school-aged and the other five are adult-aged. Fatuma owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past ten years.  She sells to her community and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Fatuma is requesting  a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 45 years old and married with seven children and one dependent, whom she is taking care of after the death of his parents. She sells groceries in the central market. She also does agriculture as another source of income. With the income from her business, she has managed to pay tuition for her two children at the university and other schoolgoing children, though through a lot of hardships and struggle to look after her family. 

Teopista is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX only for buying more stock for her grocery. 

Her major challenge is the inadequate income to support her family financially, most especially in paying school fees for her children. Her dream is to construct a permanent house for her family since the current one is in a sorry state. She is an honest and hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Al-Qws Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Qws, which consists of four female members who live in Aden, Yemen. They are hardworking and responsible women. They took a loan of 150,000 YER.

Zainb is 51 years old, married, and lives together with her family in a poor area of Aden, Yemen. She works hard as an employee in the public sector, but earns a low salary that is not enough to cover the household expenses. She has an old house and intends to refurbish her house, but the saved amount of her income will not cover the cost of construction supplies. So, she applied for a loan from AMB to buy building materials, such as sand, wood, and cement, to use to refurbish her house. With this loan, she hopes to live comfortably with her family. She is grateful for the loan, and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as sand, wood, and cement, to use to refurbish her house.

loans.name: Provia

texts.en:
Provia is 40 years, married, and has six children and two dependants who she is taking care of due to the death of their parents.

Provia is a farmer who mainly deals in coffee and banana growing. She also operates a boutique to get additional income. Together with her husband, who deals in produce, they have managed to construct a permanent house for the family and also managed to pay school fees for his school-going children. 

Provia is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizer for her banana and coffee plantation so that she can manage to get more yield from the plantations.

Her major challenge is inadequate income to support her family financially, most especially paying tuition for her children and the two dependants.

Her dream is to own the largest coffee and banana plantation, supplying all the people in her region.

She is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
María Hilda de 33 años de edad tiene un grado de educación de primaria completa, es ama de casa y agricultora, casada y madre de 3 hijos, los dos mayores estudian en la universidad y el menor en secundaria. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura especialmente en la siembra y cultivos de café pero también cultiva maíz y frijol siendo este un negocio familiar por tradición. María Hilda tiene mucho conocimiento sobre el trabajo de campo pero en compañía de su esposo ha adquirido nuevas técnicas de cultivo y ha aprendido a cultivar nuevos productos que ella anteriormente no lo hacía. En este tipo de trabajo se involucran todos como familia ya que a sus hijos es inculcado por medio de este rubro el valor y el costo de las cosas, el sacrificio que ellos como padres hacen para que ellos (hijos) tengan un mejor futuro y un mejor bienestar para sus familias el día de mañana.
Ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, fertilizantes, insecticidas, etc. con los cuales podrán asistir 2 manzanas de tierra cultivadas de café.
Sus planes son los de poder mejorar sus cultivos para obtener ganancias netas re-invertirlas y salir de su compromiso para así mismo poder seguir gozando de los beneficios que nuestra institución da para salir adelante y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y dar la oportunidad de convertirlos en los buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
María Hilda is 33 years old and is married with of three children, two of whom are in college and the youngest is in high school. María Hilda is a farmer and homemaker who was only able to complete elementary school. María's husband is also a farmer, and together the two farm coffee, corn and beans. María has lots of experience in the agricultural industry, some of which she learned from family traditions, and some of which she learned from her husband. Both María and her husband like their children to participate in the farming operation whenever possible, since hard work helps instill the true value of food and possessions in the next generation. María and her husband work extremely hard to provide for their children.

With the support from this loan, María plans to purchase agricultural inputs for use in tending her coffee crops, including manure, fertilizers, insecticides, etc. María's future plans are to strengthen her crops and increase overall profits and income so that she can pay back the loan, continue her participation in the community bank and give her children the best education and future possible.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products for use in tending her coffee plants.

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en:
Mehnaz is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is a hard-working and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing it for the past four years. 

She knows the techniques of stitching very well. She sews garments for the nearest factories; her husband brings cloth from the factory. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has became out of order due to continuously working. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.
Mehnaz thanks Kiva and her field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nagma's Group

texts.en:
Nagma belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She does not have any offspring to support her in old age. Her husband is a blacksmith. He manufactures iron accessories for doors and windows in houses. He has been providing door to door services to weld the broken accessories.

A few days ago, his welding plant became out of order due to a fluctuation in electricity, and he needs to purchase a new one. This is the only source of income. He is unable to generate income in the absence of a welding plant. He wants to buy a new welding plant but he does not have enough money due to a lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Nagma requested a loan from BRAC, an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband can buy a welding plant for manufacturing.  She thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a welding plant for manufacturing.

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Salama is a single woman in her early 40s. She has four children: two are in school, while two have finished school.

To earn a living, for three years in her area, she has been running several businesses, including a beauty salon, a mini supermarket, Max malipo, and a transportation business. She works from 8 am to 10 pm everyday, which allows her to earn good monthly profits.

This would be Salama's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start Max malipo, restock her supermarket, and open a beauty salon. Proudly, she notes that she fully repaid both of her prior loans. She used the profits generated as a result of the prior loans to pay school fees and household expenses, and she saved the remaining funds in her bank account. She would like to use the requested loan proceeds to restock missing items in the supermarket and to increase her stock of salon equipment. In the future, she dreams of building her own house.

Salama will share this loan with her loan group, FAITH. FAITH has seven members, who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to expand and improve her businesses by purchasing inventory for her supermarket and salon.

loans.name: Abdulakim

texts.en:
Abdulakim is a purposeful man. He is 30 years old. He has ‘golden hands’. He has been busy making gates. He makes gates from black metal. 

Abdulakim is married and has two children. His children are non-adults. His wife has been busy growing greens at home. She has a hotbed. Abdumalik is the main feed keeper of his family. He wants to increase his working capital and develop his business. In this way he is going to maximize profits and provide his family with better living conditions. He is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy metal for increasing his working capital. He will be able to produce more gates. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy metal for increasing his working capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 27 years old and supports 8 people in her family.  She is blessed with two children, ages 1 and 2.  She has been in business for 12 years now and her monthly income is 40,000 KES.  She has asked for a loan to purchase more stock for her general shop.  This is her third loan and she successfully repaid her previous loans.

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family is to built a plots.

loans.use: to buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a single lady of 34 years old. She is a mother of two children. She sells secondhand clothes in Kiambu and also runs a motorcycle transport business. She has been in this business for four years and gets a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings.

This will be Hannah's first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to buy clothes for resale. In the future she wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Meet Michael, a farmer living in the highlands of Kericho, a great place for agriculture. He is married and has two children. He has been in farming for four years, where he is involved with mixed farming. His main source of income is milk, poultry, and a bit of vegetables and tea. Like most farmers in Kericho, he has really invested in dairy farming because there is a good return on it.

Michael chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they have an easy repayment mode on their loan. He learned that he should pay the loans on time to avoid defaulting.This loan will benefit his family because by building the dairy unit, his cows will produce more because of the favorable environment.He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agnes is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She sells drugs, which she has been doing for five years. Agnes started her business after realizing that her husband could hardly support the family with his earnings. High license fees and inadequate capital to meet the demand pose a challenge to her business growth 

Agnes is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy drugs to sell. She hopes to educate her children up to university and to start other income generating activities to earn more income. She also dreams of owning a pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase drugs to sell.

loans.name: Estanita

texts.en:
Estanita is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates a food selling business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years. She earns additional income from general store.

Estanita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, milk, etc. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a married woman. She and her husband have five children. Two of their children attend school, while the other three are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Everline operates a cereal-selling business. She sells from her home to neighbors and passersby. One of her major business challenges is seasonality. In addition to her cereal-selling business, she works as a dairy farmer.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 100,000 KES to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for re-sale. She explains that she joined Yehu to receive financial support.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing sacks of maize, beans, and rice for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married woman. She and her husband have four children: three are in school, and one is an adult. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

To earn a living, Neema operates a food production business. Specifically, she makes foods such as beans and chapati (flat bread) for passersby and neighbors. She has been in this business for the past two years.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and to establish her own restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to expand her food production business by purchasing inventory such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en: Mgeni is asking for a loan because she believes that with it she will be able to improve her soft drinks business. Her previous loan enabled her to save money and investment it well. To date her previous loan has allowed her to maintain her profit level; she uses her profits to help her family cover their personal expenses. The loan of KSH 50,000 Mgeni is requesting will help her purchase more fruit, such as mangoes and oranges, for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit, such as mangoes and  oranges, for her business.

loans.name: Jonathan Emmanuel

texts.es:
Jonathan, es un joven de familia, vive junto con sus padres, es soltero y no tiene hijos, ya posee estudios que lo acreditan como arquitecto, ha emprendido su negocio de Diseños Profesionales Arquitectónicos. Por sus conocimientos en el área no tiene algún problema en brindar este servicio.
Comprara papel, lápiz, reglas, material para hacer maquetas, son cosas especiales para la elaboración de los diferentes diseños. Será de gran ayuda para tener todo lo necesario y terminar sus diseños a tiempo, tendrá mejores ganancias, dará un buen servicio a sus clientes, y mejorara su economía.
Su sueños es establecer mejor su negocio, para tener mejores ingresos y apoyar en los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Jonathan is a young family man and lives with his parents. He is single and has no children. He already has a degree in architecture and has started his business, Professional Architectonic Designs ("Diseños Profesionales Arquitectónicos"). Due to his knowledge in the area, he has no trouble providing this service.
Jonathan will purchase paper, pencils, rulers and material to build scaled models. These are special items to elaborate the different designs. It will be very helpful to have all he needs and be able to finish his designs in time. This will improve his profits, he will provide good service for his clients and it will improve his economy. His dreams are to better establish his business to improve his income and contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase paper, pencils, rulers, material to build scaled models.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana, se ha decidido por otro crédito para invertir en productos para su tienda, comprara azúcar, pollo, arroz, frijoles, bebidas, jabón entre otros, con esto tendrá surtido el negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes y seguir ampliando su negocio.
Con el crédito anterior tuvo como beneficio mejores ventas, clientes nuevos, aumento sus ganancias, cancelo las cuotas de su crédito y su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to take out another loan to buy products for her shop. She plans to buy sugar, chicken, rice, beans, drinks, soap and other items so she can have a well stocked shop to serve her customers better and continue to increase her business. 

With her previous loan she benefitted from better sales and new customers. She increased her profits, paid off her loan instalments and her family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, chicken, rice, beans, drinks, soap and other items.

loans.name: Umi

texts.en:
Umi is married with three children, two are in school and one is underage. They stay in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and rental bills.

Umi has operated a clothes selling business for the past four years. She sells to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resale.

loans.name: Danilsa

texts.es:
Danilsa es una joven estudiante de Administración de empresa, ella esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia:Soy Danilsa, tengo 18 años de edad, nacida  y criada en Santo Domingo, lugar donde resido actualmente bajo la tutoría de mis padres, soy la tercera de cinco hermanos; Vivo en una pequeña casa en el barrio azul de los Ríos.
Desde pequeña he sido muy entregada a mis estudios, dando lo mejor de mí para sacar las mejores calificaciones en cada curso, hoy ya estoy en la universidad O&M estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, cursando el tercer cuatrimestre, las materias que me han fascinado y han hecho aun más emocionante mi trayectoria aquí en la universidad son: administración, contabilidad y matemática financiera.
El  motivo por el cual les solicito este préstamo es por la mala situación económica que estamos viviendo en mi familia, como entenderán somos cinco hermanos, mi madre trabaja como cocinera en una casa  y mi padre presta sus servicios a una compañía de decoraciones, ambos ganando un sueldo mínimo, esto hace que para ellos no les sea posible continuar apoyándome. Sí ustedes tomaran en cuenta mi caso y facilitaran este préstamo a quien suscribe yo podría realizar mis estudios sin ningún intermedio y darle otro giro a mi vida tanto de manera profesional como personal.
Decidí estudiar esta carrera porque me identifico en todo lo relacionado con ella; los clientes, los negocios, el trato con los empleados y  la responsabilidad que conlleva ser un buen emprendedor, no me imagino realizando mi vida profesional en otro ámbito y  la oportunidad de poder así tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Danilsa is a young woman pursuing a university degree in Business Administration. She is requesting this loan to help cover tuition costs for her degree. This is her story:

My name is Danilsa, and I am 18 years old. I was born and raised in Santo Domingo, and I currently live there with my parents and siblings. I am the third of five children in our family, and we all live in a small house in the Azul de los Ríos neighborhood.

From the time I was very young, I loved school and academic work. I always put forth my best effort in all my classes, and as a result I am now studying Business Administration at O&M University. I am in my third semester of the program, and my favorite course subjects thus far include: administration, accounting and financial mathematics. I chose this career specifically because I love all the practical applications of Business Administration: working with clients, business concepts, being on a team with coworkers and the responsibility that comes along with being a professional and an entrepreneur. I can't imagine myself in any other field, and I hope to leverage my education and professional skills to support my family and improve their quality of life.

My family is facing several financial challenges and strains at the moment, so a loan like this gives me the best chance to be able to stay in my university program. As a family of seven with five children, my mother works as a cook in a private home and my father works on contract with a decorations company. Both of them make minimum wage and are no longer able to help me with tuition costs. I sincerely thank you in advance for your support and generosity, and for the opportunity to pursue my degree and my life dreams.

loans.use: to cover tuition costs for her university studies in Business Administration.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 43-year-old married woman. Her husband has been running a business selling milk for many years. He has five buffaloes, which he uses for milk, selling to the people in their locality. He has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to his family's income. Earlier he was selling milk from the front of his house, but now he wants to sell milk from a shop. He wants to rent a shop for milk selling, but he does not have enough savings.

Currently she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan from Kiva field partner’s BRAC Pakistan. Her husband has gradually improved his business with the support of the BRAC Pakistan. This will allow him to rent a shop. Allah Rakhi is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to the business.

loans.use: to rent a shop for selling milk.

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 47 years old, married, and from the suburb of the capital city Tbilisi. Shalva lives with his wife, grown son, and retired mother. Shalva is employed at a private company and works as a truck driver. He transports a variety of goods, depending on the needs and requests of his customers, and gets small monthly salary from the company.

Shalva has worked in transportation for nearly 20 years, and is the only person who earns money in the household. If Shalva’s loan is raised on Kiva's web-site, he plans to purchase a car and work in transportation in his free time. He will transport building materials with his car as he has loyal clients and special orders. Shalva will earn additional income and increase the family funds.
 
Shalva hopes that his initiative will be lucrative and he will be able to improve the standards of living in future.

loans.use: to buy a car and work in transportation.

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina is a 38-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband is a turner by profession and works over a lathe machine. He manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles, such as motorbikes, motor cars, and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles and the turbine and radiators. 

He has been doing this business for many years, and at this time his business is much settled. Due to continuously working on the lathe machine, some of it's important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of the effected parts, it is highly affecting the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.

Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient amount to buy spare parts to fix the problem of the lathe machine. Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy spare parts for his lathe machine.
 
Nagina hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as the family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine.

loans.name: Ia

texts.en: Ia is 32-years-old and from the town of Kutaisi. She is married with a school-aged son.  Ia’s husband works on house renovations and on special projects and earns a monthly income. Ia is jobless and stays at home. She is seeking an additional source of income and now is requesting a loan to start a clothing sales business. She will purchase apparel and household items and sell them from her house among community members. She will offer her customers quality things at accessible prices. Ia will even take orders for some clothes and items and hopes she will obtain a good income. Ia wants her son to have an education with the hope of a better economic future than hers. She hopes her business initiative will give her a chance to earn savings for her son’s well-being.

loans.use: to start a clothing sales business.

loans.name: Martin Rodriguez

texts.es: Martín de 44 años de edad reside en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos de 21 años, 20 años, 16 años y 11 años de edad. Martín se dedica a la venta de Mariscos en las diferentes zonas de su localidad. Además también se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo junto con su esposa. Estos negocios son su principal fuente de ingresos y los que le permiten llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de hacer crecer su negocio solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mariscos y productos de belleza por catálogo para tener un mayor inventario que le permita aumentar más su clientela.
texts.en:
Martín is 44 years old and lives with his wife and their 4 children, ages 21, 20, 16 and 11. Martín makes a living working with his wife and selling seafood as well as health and beauty products from catalogs. These two business endeavors are their family's only source of income for supporting their children.

With the support from this loan, Martín plans to purchase seafood as well as health and beauty products to stock his businesses. He hopes this investment will help him to strengthen and expand his businesses, customer base and the variety of products he can offer to clients.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seafood and beauty products to stock his businesses.

loans.name: Dúo Shaday De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
dúo Shaday de San Mateo
Este dúo está conformado por doña Alma Julieta, ella tiene 33 años de edad y se dedica a la agricultura, tales como siembra  de ejote, arveja y maíz, como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de arina y haba, en San Mateo Milpas Altas,  ella está solicitando el crédito, para la siembra de ejote y arveja china y compra de abono y una bomba para fumigar, para preparar sus  tierras y poder tener buena cosecha en esta temporada, su deseo es apoyar a su esposo en los ingresos de su hogar y que sus hijos tengan una mejor oportunidad de vida, lo que ella no tuvo en su momento de infancia. esta totalmente agradesida con kiva ya que ha sido de mucha ayuda para su actividad.
texts.en:
Dúo Shaday de San Mateo Group
This group of two includes Alma Julieta, who is 33 years old and works in agriculture. She grows crops such as green beans, peas and corn. As a secondary activity, she sells flour and dry beans in San Mateo Milpas Altas. She is requesting the loan in order to plant green beans and Chinese peas. She will also buy fertilizer and a sprayer for fumigation, in order to prepare her fields so that she can have a good harvest this season. Her desire is to support her husband with the family income, and to see her children have better opportunities in life, which she was not able to have in her own childhood. She is extremely grateful to Kiva, since it has been of great help for her work.

loans.use: To buy seeds for green beans and Chinese peas, as well as a fumigation sprayer.

loans.name: Dúo Jardin 2 Group

texts.es:
Dúo Jardín 

El dúo el jardín está integrado por la señora  Kimberly tiene 34 años de edad es casada y tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, Kimberly inicio su negocio hace tres años de venta de producto por catálogo y trastos de cocina y plásticos, gracias a dios le va muy bien pero ella está solicitando un préstamo para mejorar y agregar nueva mercadería a su negocio, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar en su negocio ya que el sueño de ella es darle estudio a su hijo y que tenga un futuro de muchas oportunidades para superarse.
texts.en:
Kimberly is a member of Dúo Jardín 2. She is 34 years old and is married with a two-year-old son. Kimberly started her business three years ago selling products from catalogues as well as kitchen containers and plastic items. 

With God's help the business is going well for her but she is asking for a loan to improve the business and add new merchandise. She hopes that you will be able to help her in her business because she dreams of giving her son an education and a future with lots of opportunities to do well in life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Silviya

texts.ru:
Сильвия – сельскохозяйственница из Берегово. Она занимается тепличным бизнесом уже 10 лет. Теплицы находятся на собственном земельном участке семьи. Из агрокультур Сильвия выращивает в основном огурцы и помидоры. 
Сильвии нужна сумма в 30 000 гривен для того, чтобы построить новую теплицу, с уходом за которой ей будут помогать другие члены семьи. За счет дополнительной партии овощей, выращенных в этой теплице, Сильвия надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и заштукатурить внешние стены собственного частного дома.
texts.en:
Silviya is a farmer from Beregovo. She has been farming in greenhouses for ten years. Her family owns the land where the greenhouses stand. Silviya grows mostly tomatoes and cucumbers. 

Sylvia needs 30,000 hryvnia to build a new greenhouse. Other members of her family will help her with the work. Because of the additional vegetables she will be able to grow in the greenhouse, Sylvia hopes to earn extra income and plaster the exterior walls of her home.

loans.use: construct a new greenhouse

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано родилась в 1962 года. Она вдова и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж умер молодым и Рано сама вырастила своих детей без мужа. У нее было много трудностей, но благодаря трудолюбию она вырастила своих детей, дала им образование и выдала свою старшую дочь замуж. Рано более 10 лет работает в средней школе.
