Она продает продукты питания как печенье, конфеты, бутерброды и т.п. школьникам. Рано работает с утро до вечера. Она добрая женщина и старается обеспечить своих детей хорошим условием проживания. Она планирует отремонтировать дом. Рано запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rano was born in 1962. She is a widow and has three children. Her husband died young, and she raised their children without a husband. She had a lot of difficulties, but through hard work she raised her children, gave them an education, and married off her eldest daughter. Rano has worked in a high school for more than ten years. She sells food like cookies, candy, sandwiches, etc. to schoolchildren. Rano works from morning until evening. She's a good woman and tries to provide her children with a decent standard of living. She plans to renovate their house. Rano is asking for a loan to buy building materials to renovate her house. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy building materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Anisia

texts.en:
Anisia is a woman of sixty two years, married to George, and mother of four children. She owns rental houses, sells rice, and has recently started selling tea leaves. She has been in this business for four years, and gets a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

This will be Anisia's second loan from KADET Ltd. and she plans to use the entire loan to buy a stock of rice and tea leaves for resale. In the future, she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice and tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark, a 24-year-old student living in Dalisay, Aloran, Misamis Occidental with his family, has a part-time job to help support him financially. He also helps his parents on weekends. He used his previous loan from GDMPC for his first semester school fees. To continue his educational journey, Mark requests another loan from GDMPC micro credit to pay for second semester school fees. He hopes to finish his course and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay for second semester school fees.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 35 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living from pig fattening in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been pig fattening for one year, and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 56 years old and married with three children. Luisa works very hard to provide for them.

Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Luisa has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items, such as rice, soft-drinks, bread, and other groceries. 

In the future, Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a married 42-year-old woman with one school-aged child.   Bernadeth works very hard to provide for them.

Bernadeth runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requests a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.

Bernadeth has been in this business for 14 years.

In the future Bernadeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa to sell.

loans.name: Ramiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Ramiro, está acompañado, vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos, es el responsable de cubrir todos gastos de su hogar. Se dedica a atender su taller mecánico, es un oficio que aprendió de su familia, atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m., Desde el tiempo que tiene de tener su negocio no ha tenido ningún problema en seguir luchando para mantenerlo activo.
Con el préstamo lo utilizara para comprar fricciones, espejos, aceite, desarmadores, llaves, sensores, etc., con esta inversión podrá tener muy surtido su inventario para prestar un buen servicio, atraerá nuevos clientes, generara más ingresos y podrá cancelar su deuda.
Su sueño es equipar debidamente su taller para ofrecer mejor servicio a su clientela y mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ramiro is in a relationship and lives with his partner and their four children. He is responsible for all of the household expenses. He has a mechanic’s shop, which is a trade he learned from his family. He works in the shop from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. Ramiro says that he has worked hard since he opened his business to keep it busy.

Ramiro is requesting this loan to buy brake pads, mirrors, oil, screwdrivers, wrenches and sensors, etc. He says that with this loan he will be able to better stock his inventory and give better service to his customers. Ramiro hopes to attract new customers, generate more income and pay off some debt. He says that his dream is to properly equip his shop so that he can offer a better service to his customers and improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy brake pads, mirrors, oil, screwdrivers, wrenches and sensors.

loans.name: Rita Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rita, se decidió por otro crédito para invertir en la compra de engrudo, hojas de tabaco y canela, para elaborar puros y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene que entregar a sus clientes. 
Con el préstamo anterior aumento sus ventas, tiene más clientes satisfechos, el aumento en sus ganancias le ha permitido ir cancelando sus deudas, su economía es más estable y a cambiado mucho el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en: Rita has decided to ask for another loan to invest in the purchase of paste, tobacco leaves and cinnamon to make cigars and fulfill the orders she has from her customers. With the previous loan she increased her sales and has more satisfied customers. The increase in her earnings has allowed her to pay off her debts, stabilize her finances and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy paste, tobacco leaves and cinnamon.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 45-year-old hardworking woman with 5 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a salon, but also does farming in order to raise money to support her family. Customers not paying on time and inadequate capital pose challenges to her business growth, while her desires are to educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification, and own a beauty parlor that attracts all customers irrespective of their status.

Ruth is requesting a loan to buy salon equipment, such as a dryer and chemicals, to use in the salon.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment, such as a dryer and chemicals, to use in the salon.

loans.name: Silvia Carmelina

texts.es:
Silvia, está solicitando más capital para 	su negocio de venta de pupusas, comprara aderezos, chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, aceite y gas propano, para seguir mejorando su negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior logro establecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, tiene más ganancias que le han ayudado a mantener la materia prima necesaria para trabajar y mejoro su economía lo que le facilita seguir apoyando con los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is requesting more capital for her business selling pupusas [corn cakes with fillings]. She will buy condiments, fried pork, farmer's cheese, corn, oil and propane gas in order to keep improving her business. 

With the previous loan, she was able to establish a good service for her customers. She has increased her earnings, which has helped her to maintain the supplies needed for her work and to improve her economic situation. Thus she has been able to continue helping with her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy seasonings, fried pork, farmer's cheese, corn, oil and propane gas.

loans.name: Maria Gladis

texts.es:
María, ha optado por otro crédito para estar preparada para las demandas de estas festividades navideñas. Con la inversión comprara lociones, labiales, cremas corporales, polvos, sombras, rubores, etc., tendrá muchos clientes satisfechos y mejorara sus ganancias.
Con el crédito anterior amplio su inventario, aumento sus ventas, y su economía mejoro, permitiéndole cancelar su deuda y mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María has decided to request another loan in order to be prepared for the Christmas holiday demand. She will purchase creams, lipsticks, body lotions, powder, eye shadow, blush, etc. This will help her satisfy many customers and will increase her earnings. 

She used the previous loan to increase inventory. Her sales went up and her finances improved, which allowed her to pay off her debt and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy creams, liptick, body lotions, powder, eye shadow, blush, etc.

loans.name: Abdulwasea

texts.en:
Abdulwasea is a 44-year-old married man. He lives lives with his wife and children in Taiz, Yemen.

He works in a restaurant that provides good foods for his customers. In addition to his income from working at the restaurant, he has mini-truck that he uses to provide transportation services in his area. He started the latter business to improve his family's quality of life and to cover household expenses. Recently, however, it has become apparent that the income from his business is insufficient to cover maintenance costs.

As a result, he is applying for a loan in the amount of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his mini-truck. He hopes the loan proceeds will enable him to improve his family's living standards in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his mini-truck.

loans.name: Al-Habobat Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Habobat, which consists of four ladies. Samah is 33 years old and married with children. She lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She works hard to provide for her family.

She faces a bad situation, and her husband`s income doesn`t cover her family`s expenses. She has a small house which requires money to expand the house. So, she is requesting a loan from AMB that will help pay for construction supplies to complete the building of her house.

She hopes to own a retail shop to increase her profit. This will ensure a better future and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for construction supplies to complete the building of her house.

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru:
Фаридун молодой и начинающий бизнесмен. Ему всего 20 лет. Он хочет начать свой бизнес по купле и продаже крупнорогатых скотов. Фаридун несмотря на свой юный возраст и не большой опыт работы не боится начать свой бизнес. Потому что большая часть жителей Истаравшана занимаются животноводством. И Фаридун знает, что может в любое время обратится за советом к соседям. Родители Фаридуна тоже занимались животноводством, но они держали животных для личных нужд. Весь опыт, который получил Фаридун от своих родителей, он хочет использовать в своем бизнесе. 
   Чтобы начать бизнес Фаридуну необходимо купить несколько голов крупнорогатого скота. К сожалению чтобы купить необходимое количество скота у него не хватает средств, поэтому он просит кредит. Фаридуну этот кредит очень важен. Фаридун ждет Вашей помощи!
texts.en:
Faridun is a young aspiring businessman. He is only 20 years old. He wants to start a business buying and selling cattle. Faridun, despite his young age and lack of experience, is not afraid to start a business. This is because most people in Istravshan work in animal husbandry. Faridun knows that he can go to his neighbors for advice whenever he needs it. Faridun's parents also work in animal husbandry, but they are keeping their animals to take care of their personal needs. Faridun plans to use all of the experience he has gained from his parents in his own business. 

To start the business, Faridun must buy several head of cattle. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to buy the cattle, so he is asking for a loan. This loan is very important to Faridun. Faridun is waiting for your help!

loans.use: start a new business buying and selling cattle by buying some cattle.

loans.name: Tuuraay Group

texts.en:
Abibatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Abibatu was born in Lungi, located in northern Sierra Leone, forty-five years ago. She is married to a fisherman and the couple has three children, who are attending secondary and primary schools. Abibatu sells fish and has been doing this business for ten years now.

With the help of this loan, Abibatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Abibatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)) to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock to sale.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock to sale.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Мария живет в Берегово, Западная Украина. Она занимается выращиванием тепличных овощей на продажу. Мария занимается теплицами 15 лет, земельный участок под телицами – свой. Мария выращивает огурцы, помидоры, капусту и редьку. 
Мария планирует использовать сумму в 20 000 гривен для того,чтобы построить новую теплицу. Доход с новой теплицы Мария хотела бы вложить в приобретение микроавтобуса для семьи, чтобы стало легче развозить урожай. Мария надеется, что ее дело будет стабильным бизнесом для всей семьи и со временем поможет ее детям встать на ноги и стать финансово независимыми.
texts.en:
Mariya lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. She grows vegetables in greenhouses. Mariya has been farming in greenhouses for fifteen years. She owns the land where her greenhouses sit. Mariya grows cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbage and radishes. 

Maria plans to use 20,000 hryvnia to build a new greenhouse. Mariya would like to invest profits from the new greenhouse into buying a van so that she can more easily deliver her crops. Mariya hopes that this will turn into a stable business for her entire family, and that eventually she will be able to help her children get on their feet and become financially independent.

loans.use: build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Babies3 Group

texts.en:
Mila is the featured borrower of the Babies3 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, because they have been friends since they left their hometown of the Philippines to work in Lebanon to develop their family's living.
Mila is the lady standing at the center of the picture. She is a 46-year-old married mother of three children who works as a housekeeper to provide for her children back in the Philippines with the best education and living ever.
Mila is a hard worker, but her income isn't enough to cover her children's sudden increasing needs. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school fees.
As for the other group members, Imelda is the lady sitting at the right side of the picture with the white top and Jovy is the lady in the left side of the picture.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Irma Jeanette

texts.es: Irma de 39 años de edad  ella  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, perfumes, shampoo, entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus tres hijos, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes y también desea comprar ropa ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Irma, who is 39 years old, works selling all kinds of personal products like lotion, deodorant, cream, perfume, shampoo, and other items. Her business is located in her home and she also goes out door-to-door across different neighborhoods. The earnings she makes, along with her husband's help, allow them to cover their household expenses. She lives in a relative's house with her husband and their three children. 

She wants to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase everything she needs, such as: fragrances, nail polish, deodorant, and she also wants to buy clothing because since she offers her products at affordable prices, she has a large customer base. The help requested will allow her to obtain better earnings and this will allow her to keep giving her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fragrances, nail polish, deodorants, and also clothing.

loans.name: Lorena Andrea

texts.es: la Señorita Lorena trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja vendiendo productos en un almacén, este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución,  la Señorita Lorena va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como compra de una laptop para sus estudios que durara el tiempo tres años,  la Señorita Lorena enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  viven en la zona Alto tejar, su deseo es poder hacer una maestría y así de esta manera poder tener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Lorena works as a salesperson at a grocery store to pay for her studies. This is the first loan she is requesting from this institution.  She will use the loan for various school expenses such as a laptop. Her studies will take three years.  Lorena deals with such challenges as the lack of financial support from her parents, and having to work and study at the same time. It's hard for her but she is determined to move forward, get ahead, finish her degree and practice her profession.  They live in the Alto Tejar section of La Paz.  Her wish is to earn a master's degree and be able to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Omina

texts.ru: Омина целеустремленная женщина. Она родилась в 1954 года. Омина замужем и имеет 3 дочерей. Она вместе с семьей живет бедно на северной части Таджикистана. Омина работает в местной больнице медсестрой, а ее муж работает охранником. У них маленький доход и поэтому в течение многих лет они не в состоянии сделать ремонт. Омина очень хотела бы сделать ремонт. Ее дом не отвечает стандартам жилья. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, песок, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Omina is a determined woman. She was born in 1954. Omina is married and has three daughters. She and her family live in poverty in the northern part of Tajikistan. Omina works at a local hospital as a nurse, and her husband works as a security guard. They have a small income, and therefore for many years they have been unable to do upkeep on their house. Omina would very much like to repair the house. Her house does not meet minimum standards. She is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to buy construction materials such as cement, wood, sand, paint, etc. She is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: buy wood, sand, and paint to repair her house.

loans.name: Fayziniso

texts.en: Fayziniso was born in 1961. She is a hard-working woman. Fayziniso lives with her family in the north part of Tajikistan. She has five children and some grandchildren. Her husband has been busy with animal husbandry. She has worked for more than eight years in the local hospital which is located near her house as a cleaning woman. Fayziniso is a careful mother for her children. She always wants to help her children. Her son wants to have a circumcision ceremony for his son but he has no money. Fayziniso wants to help him. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni with this aim. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to pay for a circumcision ceremony for her grandson

loans.name: Rolaina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rolaina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell woods business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. Rolaina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more woods to resell in her buy-and-sell woods business.

Rolaina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more woods to resell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 51 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena owns a business in which she buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines. She requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Elena has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 55-years-old and married with eleven children.

Angelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like sugar, coffee, eggs, chips, etc.

Angelina has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Angelina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like sugar, coffee, eggs, chips, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Los Copihues Group

texts.es: Eduardo quien aparece en la fotografía en la última fila con gafas negras y un gorro negro, es socio del Banco Comunal Los Copihues ubicado en Villarrica. Los socios de este Banco Comunal tienen entre sus negocios la venta de artesanía con goma eva, tejidos, taller mecánico. Eduardo tiene un negocio de servicio técnico e integral de informática y electrónica, que comenzó hace 5 años, lo compro por necesidad y con cartera de clientes. Su desafío es poder reinventarse además de ampliar su giro. Necesita el dinero para compara una impresora fotográfica digital para estampados de poleras, sabe que le irá muy bien ya que no tiene competencia en Villarrica, y lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es la organización de sus compañeros de Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Eduardo, who appears in the picture in the last row with black sunglasses and a black cap, is a member of the Communal Bank "Los Copihues", located in Villarrica. The members of this Communal Bank own businesses such as a foamy craftsmanship store, fabric sales or an auto repair shop. 
Eduardo's business is a computer and electronics tech service, which he started 5 years ago. He bought it out of necessity, with an existing client portfolio. 
His challenge is to be able to reinvent and expand the business. He needs the money to buy a digital photographic printer to print t-shirt patterns. He knows he will do very well because he has no competition in Villarrica. What he likes the most about working with the lending partner, Fondo Esperanza, is the organization with the fellow members from the Communal Bank.

loans.use: to purchase a digital photographic printer for t-shirt patterns for his business.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario, se dispone a aumentar su inventario por lo que solicita más capital para comprar variedad de bebidas y leña para ofrecer a sus clientes, pues su demanda de productos ha aumentado.
Con el préstamo anterior el aumento sus productos, sus ventas fueron mayores y sus ingresos fueron mejores con ellos cancelo el préstamo y ofrece a su familia un estilo de vida de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Mario is going to increase his inventory, because demand for his products has increased. That is why he is requesting more capital in order to purchase assorted beverages and firewood to offer his customers. 

He used the previous loan to increase his products. Sales went up and his income improved. He used it to pay off the loan and provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to buy assorted beverages and firewood.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 32 year old, hardworking woman. She has four children and she lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a restaurant which she started in order to supplement her seasonal farming activities. Challenges such as her customers not paying on time and the high cost of rent limit her business growth. Harriet wants to own a big restaurant in town and educate her children up to the university level. Harriet intends to use the loan to buy food stuffs to sell in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Doreen's Group

texts.en:
Doreen lives in a home with mud walls, sand or dirt floor, iron roof in Sugura village in Vihiga, Kenya. She is 26 years old, has a one-year-old son, and owns her own business. The community of Sugura village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of Vihiga Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Sugura’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Sugura, 30 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Doreen has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Teresia, Miriam, Josephine and Beatrice.

Sugura village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Doreen believes that the dispenser will save people from sickness and death in her community. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Doreen’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace, a 53-year-old woman with 5 children, lives in Shivembe B village in Kisasi, Kenya. Shivembe B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Grace and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Grace is a tea farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Grace and other promoters in her community (including: Carolyne, Felix, Ezekiel and Maurine) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Grace will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Grace wants to be a promoter because she loves taking responsibilities. She believes that the dispenser will be good for the community's health.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Grace’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community.

loans.name: Reyna Lorena

texts.es:
Reyna Lorena es una joven de 28 años de edad la cual tiene un grado de estudio primario incompleto cursado hasta el 2 grado ya que no pudo ser apoyada por sus padres por la falta de ingresos en su familia siendo ellos de muy escasos recursos. Su estado civil es (unión libre) siendo su compañero de hogar su único apoyo para los trabajos de campo que se realizan para el mantenimiento. Ella es madre de un solo hijo el cual tiene 4 meses de nacido. Su único ingreso es el cultivo de café practicando esta actividad desde hace 5 años ya que aprendió por medio de sus padres quienes por tradición y conocimiento pasado de generación en generación son caficultores. La tierra que ella y su conyugue trabajan es propia la cual está ubicada a 500 metros de distancia al cual se dirigen caminando diariamente para su debida atención.
Sus planes a futuro son mejorar su casa de habitación ya que necesita algunas reparaciones y mantenimiento, como toda madre de familia desea que su hijo sea en un futuro una persona de éxito con mucho conocimiento y con mejores oportunidades en la vida y pueda ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida en un futuro a su familia.
Reyna Lorena solicita financiamiento que será utilizado para comprar los fertilizantes ya que así podrán asistir sus cultivos de café con los que tendrá una mejor producción de su cultivo de café incrementando el ingreso económico de la familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Lorena is a young woman aged 28. She was educated at primary level only up to grade 2, as she could not be supported by her parents, owing to a lack of family finance because they were on a very low income. She lives with her common-law husband, who is her only support with the work done in the fields to provide for the household. She is the mother of their only child, a 4-month-old son. Her only income comes from the coffee crop, and she has done this job for 5 years. She learnt it from her parents, who were coffee growers by tradition, and who made use of knowledge passed down from generation to generation. The land worked by her and her husband is their own, and it is located 500 metres away. They reach it on foot each day to work there.

Their plans for the future include improving their home, as they need to make a few repairs and do some maintenance work. Like every mother, she wants her son to be successful in the future. She would like him to gain a lot of knowledge and to have better opportunities in life, and to be able to provide better conditions for the family in the future.

Reyna Lorena is asking for a loan to buy fertilisers so that they can help their coffee plants to produce a better crop, and thus increase their family income.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and manure to help with her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.en:
Anibal is an entrepreneur who has developed a small business that produces and sells fuel-efficient Ecocina cookstoves in Copan Ruinas, Honduras. These stoves eliminate smoke from the home, reduce wood consumption by 50%, and save families time collecting firewood. His E'Copan stove factory employs six people and has sold more than 5,000 stoves in three years. Prior to becoming a 'stover,' Anibal worked in agroforestry and served as vice mayor of the town of Copan Ruinas. 

Anibal would like to expand his business throughout Honduras in order to reach more families who are still cooking over dangerous open fires. In order to do this, Anibal is requesting a Kiva loan to create a distribution center in Ocotepeque, Honduras. Anibal's nephew Manuel will be able to order 50 Ecocina stoves on credit from E’Copan, and the Kiva loan will be repaid as soon as the stoves are sold. Manuel and his wife will both be employed, and their business will save lives by increasing the number of families using safe, efficient cookstoves. Eventually Anibal would like to establish eight distribution centers throughout Honduras.

loans.use: to create a distribution center for fuel-efficient cookstoves.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is from Pakistan.  She is married and has five children. 
Shahida requested a loan for her husband; he wants to start a food stall for offering Alu Chaat (a Pakistani food) in the evening to the common people of his area. For this purpose, he has needs for potatoes, tomatoes, yogurt, onions, spices, etc. in large quantities.  She helps her husband during the preparation of alu chaat at noon. In the morning he does his job over at a restaurant.  Due to an increase in expenses he wants to start to sell barbecue in the evening. 
She is 37-years-old, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that through this stall her husband would be able to get more income than earlier. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, the BRAC Pakistan team.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, yogurt, spices, onions, etc. for making chaat (Pakistani food).

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a 25-year-old married man with 2 children. He is a farmer who primarily deals in the cattle trade. In addition, he grows coffee and bananas and operates a retail shop to earn additional income. He has managed to provide for his family by earning income from all these efforts.

Leonard is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy land that he will use to graze his cows.  His major challenge is the high rent that he is paying for grazing land. He wants to buy land and eliminate his rent expense. This loan will enable him to buy more cows.
His dream is to own the largest farm in his region.

He is a honest and hardworking person.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Dúo Taller 2 Group

texts.es:
dúo taller 2
 
El dúo está integrado por las señora. Dominga tiene cincuenta años de edad (50) es casada tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad el negocio de Dominga es de venta de ropa de caballero, dama y niños también vende zapatos por catálogo, le va muy bien con sus ventas gracias a la amabilidad que tiene para atender a sus clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercaderías y para ampliar su negocio ya que necesita compra más ropa para la venta.
texts.en:
Duo Taller 2

This duo is made up of these women. Dominga, 50, is married and has three adult children. Dominga sells men's, women's, and children's clothing. She also sells shoes from a catalogue. It is going well for her thanks to the friendly way she treats her customers. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise and expand her business because she needs to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma  vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos ellos estudian actualmente, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Irma  esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa como: blusas, camisas, ropa para niños, shorts, etc. para poder seguir con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Irma lives in her own home with her husband and her children, who are currently in school. She has worked selling clothing for many years. She works as a mobile vendor, going to different markets that are close to where she lives. This is how she earns her income, and with her husband's help, they manage to meet some household expenses. Irma is asking for a loan to buy more clothing like blouses, shirts, children's clothing, shorts, etc., in order to continue with her business, which provides her with a good income. This way she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothing such as blouses, shirts, children's clothing, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Jose Anacleto

texts.es: José de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija de 15 años de edad ella estudia actualmente, él posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 12 años posee mucha clientela pues tiene la tienda bien surtida, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, José  quiere comprar más mercadería como: huevos, leche, refrescos, golosinas, granos básicos, jabón, papel higiénico, etc. y poder surtir la tienda con mas productos que sus clientes buscan para obtener mejores ganancias y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José, who is 49-years old, lives in his own home with his wife and his 15-year old daughter.  His daughter goes to school.  José has had a store set up in his home for the last twelve years.  He has a lot of customers, as his store is well-stocked.  With what he earns from his store, José is able to meet some of his household expenses.  José wants to purchase more merchandise, such as eggs, milk, soft drinks, sweets, basic grains, soap, toilet paper etc.  He wants to stock up his store with more of the products that his customers want so he can earn a better profit and thereby give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, milk, soft drinks, sweets, basic grains, soap, toilet paper etc.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina esta alegre y contenta por el apoyo y desea continuar participando en el proyecto, ella  continúa elaborando artesanía y sigue teniendo un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora tejidos como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas y otras cosas más pero también se dedica a la fabricación de telares, ella sigue participando en el banco comunal porque es una persona responsable y amable. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como lana de alpaca y oveja. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Alejandrina is both joyful and glad for the support and she wants to continue to participate in this project. She continues to make artisan goods and she still has a small workshop in her home where she makes knitted items like sweaters, scarves, and other things. She also makes woven items with a loom. She continues to participate in the communal bank because she is a responsible and kind person. On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy materials for her work, like alpaca and sheep's wool. She thanks everyone for the loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as alpaca and sheep's wool.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
Claudia Carolina  es originaria de Tecpan, tiene 32 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están su tres hijos menores de edad y se dedica a la venta de Joyeria y elaboración de costuras a maquina.
Desde hace algunos años ella empezó su propio negocio y gracias a Dios poco a poco fue conociendo a su clientela, ahora es bien conocida en la localidad donde vive por la buena atención que ella da a sus clientes.
Su esposo trabaja como mecanico y gracias al apoyo de el doña Carolina sigue adelante con su negocio.
Ella sueña con ampliar mas su negocio, surtirlo con mas variedad de productos, ya que asi ella tendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela.
texts.en:
Claudia Carolina is from Tecpan. She is 32 years old and has three minor children in her charge. She works selling jewelry and sewing. She started her own business several years ago and thankfully she was able to gradually build a customer base. Now she is well known all over town because of the good service she provides. 

Her husband works as a mechanic and thanks to his help, Carolina keeps her business going. Her dream is to further expand her business by stocking a wider variety of products, because that way she will have better earnings and will be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en:
Franciscah sells clothes in Makueni town. She sells shirts, skirts and trousers and has been in this business for the last three years. She is 62 years old, married to Peter, and they have been blessed with five children. Peter also provides additional income for the support of the family.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of shirts, trousers, skirts and pairs of socks to sell. This will enable her to meet her customers' needs as well as make more income. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family.

This is her fourth loan term and she paid all the previous loans successfully. In the future she hopes to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay is married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.

Gay has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase peanuts to make peanut butter, salted peanuts, coated peanuts, etc. to sell.

Gay has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts to make peanut butter, salted peanuts, coated peanuts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, se le presento una oportunidad de invertir nuevamente en el cultivo de maíz. Invertirá en la compra de plaguicidas, pesticidas, herbicidas, abono y pagara el alquilar del terreno para poder sembrar maíz.
Con la inversión del préstamo anterior logro una buena producción, una cosecha de mejor calidad, su economía ha mejorado en gran medida, su familia está muy bien y él les da un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Roberto once again has the opportunity to grow corn. He will purchase fungicide, insecticide, weedkiller, fertilizer, and he will pay the rent for the land in order to be able to plant corn. With the previous loan, he had good production, a better-quality harvest, and his household economy has greatly improved. His family is well, and he provides them with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fungicide, pesticide, weedkiller, fertilizer, and to pay the rent for the land.

loans.name: Losina

texts.en:
Losina is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, biscuits, bread, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, biscuits, bread, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es:
José, está acompañado, vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 15 años. Ambas de penden económicamente de él, no posee ayuda del extranjero. Desde la  edad de quince años aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura y ganadería, por su experiencia en el área no ha tenido dificultades en ejercerla.
Con el crédito comprar abono, pesticidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas. Le ayudara a tener todo lo que necesita para preparar la tierra y sembrar maíz, espera aumentar su producción, sus ventas y mejorar su economía para darle lo mejor a su familia.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para tener los ingresos necesarios para mejorar la alimentación de su familia y hacerle mejoras a su familia.
texts.en: José lives with his spouse and his 15-year-old  daughter. Both depend on him economically. He doesn't receive help from abroad. At 15, he learned to work farming and raising livestock. Because of his experience, he has not had difficulties with this work. He will buy fertilizer, pesticides, and fungicides with his loan. This will help him to have everything that he needs to prepare the land and plant corn. He hopes to increase his production and his sales, and to improve his household economy in order to give his family the very best. His dream is to expand his business so that he can earn the income he needs to improve his family's nutrition and make them better off.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and fungicides.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos, vive junto a sus padres, es soltero y no recibe ayuda económica del extranjero, se dedica a cultivar frijol, maíz y jícama, lo hace desde hace 20 años lo aprendió de su padre, sus horarios son de lunes a domingo y de 6:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., hasta la fecha no ha tenido algún problema que le evite seguir trabajando.
Con el crédito comprara abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y semilla, los cuales utilizara para preparar la tierra y sembrar sus cultivos, espera que dicha inversión de cómo resultado una abundante producción, mejores ventas, atraer más clientes, y ganancias superiores  a las que hoy tiene.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio, mejorar su economía, darles a sus padres una alimentación y salud adecuada para ellos.
texts.en:
Marcos lives with his parents. He is single and doesn't receive financial help from abroad. He makes a living cultivating beans, corn, and jícama, which he has been doing for 20 years. He learned the skill from his father. His schedule is Monday through Sunday from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. To this point, he hasn't had any problems that have prevented him from working.

With this loan, he will buy manure, fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds. He will use these to prepare the land and plant his crops. He hopes this investment results in an abundant crop, better sales, more customers, and better income than he has right now.

He dreams of growing his business, improving his economic situation, and providing his parents with adequate nutrition and health.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina de 54 años de edad  vive con su esposo y sus hijos, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida en un chalet que posee en la playa que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años,  tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, Doña josefina desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Josefina is 54 years old. She lives with her husband and her children. She is a fighter and she is responsible for providing for her family and getting them what they need to survive. She currently works selling food from a villa that she owns on a beach that is close to where she has lived for many years. She has a lot of regular customers, since she sells plates of food at a good price. Josefina wants to grow her business by purchasing tables, chairs, and more ingredients, to vary her menu. She would also like to have a little bit more economic capital, but she does not have enough money to make this investment. She asks for a loan to purchase the previously mentioned items. This way, she will have better profits and be able to give her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs, ingredients: vegetables, rice, chicken, meat, etc.

loans.name: Santos Francisco

texts.es: Santos vive en casa alquilada con su compañera de vida y sus hijos, el se dedica a la reparación de electrodomésticos desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación posee mucha clientela pues realiza un excelente trabajo y también ofrece buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, santos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos y electrodomésticos arruinados para reparar y luego comercializarlos y asi poder obtener mas ganancias y seguir dándole a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Santos lives in a rented home with his partner and children. He has worked repairing appliances for several years. His business is located in his home. He has many customers because he does excellent work and he also offers good prices. With what he earns on the job, he is able to cover household expenses. Santos is asking for a loan to buy replacement parts and broken appliances that he can fix and sell, in order to earn more income and continue giving his family what they need with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and appliances.

loans.name: Silvia Yaneth

texts.es: Silvia de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa de un familiar con su hijo de 3 años de edad, ella posee un pequeño negocio de venta de refrescos y golosinas ubicado en la parada de autobuses que se encuentra  cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de la casa, Silvia esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más refrescos y golosinas por mayor y asi poder seguir con su trabajo y poderle dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Silvia, 31, is a single mother. She lives in the home of a relative along with her 3-year-old son. She has a small business selling soft drinks and snacks at the bus stop near her house. With the money she earns from her sales, she helps with the household expenses. Silvia is asking for a loan to be able to buy more soft drinks and snack wholesale. This way she can continue working and give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and snacks wholesale

loans.name: Jose Samuel

texts.es: José de 42 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, él posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, hasta ahora el negocio le ha dado muy buenos resultados ya se hizo de mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; José es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto y sobre todo humilde, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan superarse y llegar al éxito; quiere hacer crecer el negocio pero necesita de capital para compra de material por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. el cliente tiene buenas referencias crediticias y está seguro que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: José is 42 years old. He lives with his two children in his own house. He has a workshop for metal structures, where he creates doors, balconies, and fences, among other items. He has dedicated himself to this business for several years, and he has a lot of experience which helps him to improve his work day by day. Up to now his business has given him very good results, since he has gained a lot of customers. They seek him out because of the quality of his work, his affordable prices, and above all because he performs the work to the customer's satisfaction. José is a very hard-working, honest and above all humble man. He is always looking out for new opportunities which will allow him to get ahead and achieve success. He wants to expand his business, but he needs capital to buy materials. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy iron, other metals, tools, etc. This client has good credit references and is sure he will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time provide economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy iron, other metals, tools, etc.

loans.name: Adrian De Jesus

texts.es: Adrian de 49 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en casa propia, el posee un chalet cerca de su lugar de residencia  donde vende gaseosas, golosinas, fruta, etc. desde hace varios años posee clientela por tener su negocio en un lugar muy estratégico, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gasto de su hogar, Adrian esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos para seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias  y así podrá seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adrian is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and four children. For several years, he has owned a stand near his home where he sells soft drinks, candy, fruit, etc. He has a good customer base because his business is set up in a very strategic location. The earnings from his business allow him to cover some of his household expenses.

Adrian is requesting a loan to purchase more products in order to keep working. His business generates good profits and this will allow him to continue giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, candy, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gasto de su hogar, vive con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposo y sus 3 hijos, Ana está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar maíz por quintales y cal para poder seguir con su trabajo y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 42 years old, lives in a relative's house. She has been making and selling tortillas for five years. Her business is set up in her home and what she earns allows her to cover some of her household expenses. She lives with her family, which comprises her husband and their three children. 

Ana is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy corn in bulk and lime so that she can keep working and can give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime.

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Jane is in her mid 30s and is single with three children who are still in school. She has run two businesses, food vending and selling cosmetics, for two years now. She works from 6:00am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Jane's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a refrigerator and restocked missing items in the grocery store. She is doing great and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees, cover household expenses and buy a sofa set, cupboard, TV set and DVD player. She will use this loan to buy more stock of food and to start selling cosmetics. She dreams of building her own house.  

Jane will share this loan with her loan group, Karibu View, which has four member who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food and to start selling cosmetics.

loans.name: Talabsho

texts.en:
Talabsho is from Tajikistan. He works in a rural area. It’s a country where one can disconnect from the noise and appreciate the beauty of nature since its scenery is very beautiful. He loves his country very much.
Talabsho is a young man. He is married and has three children. To make a living, he sells food items in a food shop. He has been engaged in this business for eight years. He began his business with animal husbandry and then he changed his business. He works around 10 hours a day. He thinks his activity is going well because he is very kind and he always loves what he does.
He is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD which will be used to buy more food items to sell.
He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy food items to increase working capital

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is 51 years old and operates a farming business. He is married and blessed with three children. Jimmy works hard so he can earn greater income for his family's necessities. According to him, working hard is not enough to operate a farming business; instead, it requires finances in order to improve his farming business. For this reason, Jimmy decided to ask for a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP. This will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Hopefully, he can earn more income than his usual income in order to secure his family's future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 59 years old and married. She is a farmer in Emali town and has been in the farming business for 12 years. Besides farming, Alice also runs a retail shop. Together with her spouse, who is a mason and provides additional income, they have been blessed with three children. She plans to use the requested loan to buy feed for her dairy cattle. She will also buy retail goods, such as maize flour, sugar, rice and cereals, to sell in her shop. Alice will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to buy more cow feed. This is her eighth loan and she paid back all of her previous loans successfully. In the future Alice hopes to live a stable life with her family.

loans.use: to buy cow feed and retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is studying business administration at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City.  Her mother, a widow with four children, is earning an income for the family. She sells coconuts in town to make a living. The children help their mother on weekends in her business . Her previous loan was used to buy school materials and books. Recently, she requested another loan to cover the costs of her school allowances for the second semester. She is thankful to know that GDMPC helps students who want to have a better future to pursue their dreams..

loans.use: to cover the costs of her school allowances for the second semester

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 36 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with two children. He owns a spare parts and welding shop in Kitengela town. Right now he gets a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He plans to use the loan to purchase a generator. This will enable him to offer welding services to other customers in other areas of the town and beyond. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of spare parts.

This is his six loan term and he paid all his previous loans successfully. Titus hopes to have a successful business and a good family.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 19-year-old student of Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City studying Business Administration. She is a working student because her father has already died and her mother is earning from her work as a caretaker. She was determined to finish her studies and find a job in the future to help her family. Her previous loan was used to buy books and school materials. Recently, she requested another loan to cover the costs of her second semester allowances. She wants to be successful in her future and be able to help the family to improve their living.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her second semester allowances

loans.name: Monna

texts.en: Monna of Dulapo, Oroquieta City is 21 years old and a proud member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). She helps her parents cultivate their farm to earn a living and to support her studies, but this year their harvest is not good enough to pay for their basic needs. She already had her previous loan from GDMPC that she used for buying school materials. Recently, she requested another loan for the second semester school expenses. She hopes to get a job after finishing her studies and to be able to help her parents improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the second semester school expenses

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma.Theresa is 24 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Theresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Ma.Theresa would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egga, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
In Chemongo village in Vihiga, Kenya, Ruth has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Ruth is a hardworking member of the community with 2 children. Ruth lives with her family in a house made of mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof.

Chemongo village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a lake. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Ruth and the 13 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Ruth has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Ruth volunteered to be the promoter because it might of help in future and she wants to help the community because by them using chlorine, water-borne diseases will be prevented. There are also three other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Selphine, Jackline and Jane.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Ruth’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Friendly, hardworking, trustworthy and well-known Susan lives in a home with mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof. She lives with her 4 children in Kakubutu village in Vihiga, Kenya. The community of Kakubutu village collects their drinking water from an unprotected well because there is no piped water supply in this part of Vihiga Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Kakubutu’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Kakubutu, 12 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Susan has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Rose, Elizabeth, Emma and Josephine.

Kakubutu village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Susan believes that the dispenser will help to prevent waterborne diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Susan’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
In Gambo village in Vihiga, Kenya, James has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. James is a friendly, hard-working, reliable, well-liked member of the community with 6 children. James lives with his family in a house made of mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof.

Gambo village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. James and the 15 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

James has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. James volunteered to be the promoter because want to improve the community's health and he wants to help the community to kill bacteria and promote health. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: John, Everlyne, Dorcas and Batrimayo.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that James’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
A proud holder of his secondary school certificate Stephen is 46 years old and has 6 children. He lives in Gimudi village in Vihiga in Kenya. Gimudi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Stephen and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Stephen grows crops for food, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Stephen and other promoters in his community (including: Thomas, Francis, David and Sarah) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Stephen will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. He wants to be a promoter because he likes serving the community. Stephen believes that the dispenser will provide chlorine that kills bacteria and hence prevents illness.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Stephen’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is age 27 and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is taking a loan for her husband’s painting shop. In fact, her husband provides the services of banner-writing for advertisements. His writing is very attractive because he has been writing banners for many years and has a great gift for banner writing. He can write in Urdu, English, and Arabic languages as well.

He uses pieces of cheap cloth, paint, and brushes for banner writing. He does not have enough stock of paint and cloth to continue his services. Therefore, Asma requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy multicoloured cans of paint, brushes, and cloth. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy multicoloured cans of paint, brushes, and cloth for banner-writing services.

loans.name: Daphine

texts.en:
Daphine is a divorced woman, 45 years old, with six children, one of whom is attending school. She lives in Kyotera town council with her children and grandchild. She operates a bar business in Kyotera town council and carries out cattle farming as a side business. She started her business in 2010.

She works 7 days in a week and 15 hours per day and began her business to earn a living and get money to care for her children. She has acquired this loan to boost her bar business and her clients are residents of Kyotera and those from nearby villages.

Her future hopes are to enlarge her business and set up a disco club and her challenges are limited capital and clients who take a long time to settle their debts. She describes herself as an honest and hardworking woman who encourages lenders always to monitor their clients before giving those loans to find out whether the business exists.

loans.use: To buy drinks to sell in the bar

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with five adult children. She owns a house that has electricity but does not have plumbing. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanakombo operates a business cooking staples like beans, rice, and dumplings for sale to passersby and neighbors. 

With 40,000 KES she wants to purchase food items including wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establishing a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva , es casada y no tiene hijos , vive en casa propia, la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel primario. Sigue con su negocio de elaboracion de sorteo (Suerte  sin Blanca ) vende en colegios , tiendas de varrio ferias y otros. 
En vista de que le va bien en le negocio, este otro  crédito lo requiere para la compra de mayor cantidad y  variedad de juguetes para asi poder armar sus sorteos   de distintos modelos tanto para varon o mujer y tener a disposicion juguetes para asi poder cumplir con sus requerimientos. 
El sueño de Elva es que sus sortes se distribuyan a nivel nacional y tener mejores ingresos  
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elva is married but doesn’t have any children.  She lives in a home of her own, located in the Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto.

She has an elementary school education, has a raffle business (Suerte sin Blanca), and sells in schools, variety stores, fairs, and other locations.

Her business is doing well and she needs this loan to buy a variety of toys for boys and girls so she can have prizes for her drawings and be able to meet her requirements.

Elva’s dream is for her drawings to be held nationally and have better income.  This will be her fourth loan through IMPRO and her second with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy toys in order to continue with her raffle business.

loans.name: Eliza Jane

texts.en: Eliza Jane wants to be an accountant in the future. She is studying for a BS in Accountancy at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City. His father was earning a living as a laborer and he earns good enough for their daily living. She had joined GDMPC recently and requests a loan to cover the second semester of school allowances. She wants to finish her studies and become successful so that she would be able to help her parents in the future.

loans.use: to cover the second semester school allowances

loans.name: Olimshoh

texts.en:
Olimshoh is a kind man. He lives in a small village in the North part of Tajikistan with his wife and two children who are two and four years old. His wife is a housewife. He is the main feed keeper of his family. The only source of income for the family is from animal husbandry.  He has 3 cows and 25 sheep. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

He wants to develop his business but he does not have money to buy more cattle. This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle and, with the profit, improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Hesbon's Group

texts.en:
Hesbon is an active community member of Jebrongo village in Vihiga, Kenya. Jebrongo village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Hesbon and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Hesbon works as a day/hired laborer, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Hesbon and other promoters in his community (including Vincent, Violet, Hildah and Laban) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Hesbon will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. He wants to be a promoter because he lives near the waterpoint and knows he can care for the dispenser well. Hesbon believes that the dispenser will prevent diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Hesbon’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Abesigamukama Farmers Group

texts.en: Mabel is a member of the above-mentioned group, which is new to UGAFODE Microfinance. The group has 15 members and most of the group members are businessmen and women. Mabel is 43 years old, a mother of five and a businesswoman dealing in hiring tents and chairs. She started the business in 2011 and she has carried it on to date. Her business is located in Ishaka Town and her clients are mainly people in Ishaka and the neighboring towns. She applied for 800,000 shillings to be able to buy more chairs for hire. In addition to the tent business, she is a pastor in one of the churches in Ishaka Town and this contributes to her income since she is paid a salary per month. She is a hard working woman who is determined to outdo her competitors in the same area so that she gets more income to help her expand the business and be able to provide for the needs of her family. She is grateful that the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE are interested in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy chairs that she will hire out to earn income

loans.name: Nigesa

texts.en:
Nigesa is a widowed woman who has been blessed with six children, all of whom are adults. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Nigesa has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Al-Astwra Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Astwra and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Mriam is one of the many Yemeni women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. She is 41 years old and is married. She has a year and a half of experience with her home-based sewing and tailoring business and has an established client base. She is now trying to improve her business and would like to focus on improving her own work experience. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a sewing machine for her business. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Tumika Group

texts.fr:
Jacques  fait partie du groupe  Tumika et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de 22 ans.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz, limonade, lait,…) depuis  8 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  50kg de riz, 50 kg de haricot et une caisse de limonades, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  avoir sa propre maison et sa famille.
texts.en:
Jacques is part of the group Tumika and lives in Bujumbura. He is 22 years old and unmarried. He has been running a grocery store for eight years.  

This is his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase 50 kg of rice, 50 kg of beans, and a case of lemonade drinks to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to have his own house and family.
