Due to Gulshan's diligent work the family now owns two milk cows, two calves, 10 chickens and has 3 acres of land where they grow potatoes and beans. Gulshan's husband is a taxi driver and also works as a mechanic at a auto repair shop. Since the kids are all still young, Gulshan's husband works hard to save money for their future and is a very active father. The total monthly income of the family is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to expand the livestock herd, Gulshan has turned to micro-finance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan to purchase another cow. She plans to use the profits from the loan to continue expanding the family's herd and save money for her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana desde hace 16 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas trabaja 4 días a la semana, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la calle principal de su colonia, posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad e higiene que tiene a la hora de elaborar los alimentos, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 19, 16 y 4 años de edad, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios como: chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz, tomates, repollos, aceite, etc. para poder seguir con sus cenatas que le generan buenas ganancias y así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
For 16 years Ana has been making and selling “pupusas” (traditional Salvadoran dish – thick, hand-made corn tortillas). She works 4 days a week. Her business is located on a main street in her city. She has many clients due to her friendliness and hygienic approach to food preparation. She is able to pay some household expenses with her earnings from her job and with her husband’s help. She lives in her own house with her husband and their 3 children ages 19, 16, and 4. 

Ana is requesting a loan to purchase materials needed such as: pork rinds, fresh cheese, beans, corn, tomatoes, cabbage, oil etc... to be able to continue preparing food which generates a good profit and thus be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase pork rinds, fresh cheese, beans, corn, tomatoes, cabbage, oil etc...

loans.name: Heyrankhanim

texts.en:
Heyranxanim is 48 years old, married and has a child. She lives in the Sabuncu settlement in the Baku region with her daughter and husband. Her husband is a writer. Their daughter is 13 years old and she goes to school.

Heyranxanim rents a store, and in this store she sells women's clothes. Now she needs a loan amount of 2,150 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan she wants to buy hangers and new seasonal clothes.

She is thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations for this loan. In the future she wants to have her own store and improve her business. She wants to increase her monthly income to provide for her daughter's future.

loans.use: to buy hangers and new seasonal clothes

loans.name: Yessica Veronica

texts.es: La jovencita Yessica de 25 años de edad, es madre de una niña de 5 añitos que asiste a la escuela, y su primer prioridad en la vida es su hija,  se dedica al comercio de ropa, también vende helados y refrescos en su casa,  negocio que puso gracias al apoyo de su esposo, Yessica busca la manera de cómo salir adelante, haciendo mejoras en su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para hacer un cuarto, ya que actualmente cuenta solamente con uno y es incomodo, pues la familia va creciendo, por lo que necesita ir acondicionando su casita poco a apoco,  cuenta con una parte de los materiales pero aun le hace falta cemento, arena, bloques	, hierro. Por este motivo solicita el apoyo de este primer crédito para completar los materiales y levantar la obra.
texts.en:
Yessica is 25 years old and has a five-year-old daughter who goes to school. Yessica says that her daughter is her first priority in life. Yessica works selling clothing, and she also sells ice cream and soft drinks in her home – a business that she says she was able to start thanks to the help of her husband.

Yessica is looking to get ahead and to do some improvements in her home. She is requesting this loan to build another room, as at the moment they are uncomfortable with only one room and their family is growing. She would like to renovate their home a little bit at a time. She says that she already has part of the materials, but that she still needs cement, sand, blocks and iron. She is requesting this loan to buy these materials and to build the room.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica  al venta de minutas desde hace 3 años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por ser un producto muy vendible  y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo que es electricista y sus tres hijos, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sabores, jaleas, hielo, vasos, cucharas, etc. y así seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The member has been selling fruit drinks as a street vendor in neighborhoods close to her house for three years. She has a lot of customers because her product is salable and she is very friendly. She is able to pay some household expenses with earnings from her job. 

She lives with her husband, an electrician, and their three children in their own house. She has applied for a loan to buy food coloring, jellies, ice, cups, spoons, and more to keep working, since this is her only income source and the work allows her to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy food coloring, jellies, ice, cups, spoons, etc.

loans.name: Uzinduzi Group

texts.en:
Mashaka, who is in her late 20s, is married with one son who is still small. She has been running a beauty salon for two years now. She works from 09am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mashaka's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to restock the missing salon equipment in her salon. She is doing fine and was happy with the loan. She has paid back all of her loan successfully.  She used the profit to cover household expenses and to take care of her child. She will use this loan buy more and advanced salon equipment. She dreams of owning an international salon.

Mashaka will  share this loan with her loan group, Uzinduzi, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more and advanced salon equipment.

loans.name: Shirley Patricia

texts.es: La Señora  Shirley  tiene 22 años tiene un hijo pequeño que tiene la edad de 3 meses, ella se dedica a la venta  de comida y almuerzo en su anaquel que se encuentran en la zona de Santa Rosa, este  préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución La Señora  Shirley  va a usar este préstamo para mantenimiento de anaquel y reparación del mismo también compra de material de trabajo para  su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  la Señora  Shirley  necesita refaccionar su quiosco el cual está deteriorado y como ya se avecinan las épocas de lluvia tiene que cambiar las calaminas del quiosco y también cementar la parte de la base del puesto,  la Señora  Shirley  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que  tiene que levantarse muy temprano cuando hace  frio para preparar su comida,  es propensa a agarrar reumatismo el cual es muy frecuente en personas con esa actividad,  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar insumos y mesas y sillas para poder vender más cómodamente y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio su deseo  para su negocio es el de tener una pensión de comida variada más grande donde pueda vender más y mejor y poder superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Shirley is 22 years old and has a 3-month-old baby. She sells food and lunches from her stand which is located in the Santa Rosa zone. This loan is her first with the institution, and Shirley will use it for the maintenance and repair of her stand. She will also buy work material for her business. 

Shirley's reason for requesting this loan is that she needs to repair her kiosk and also cement the base of the stand. She faces such challenges in her business as having to get up to prepare the food very early when it's cold out, and she is prone to catching rheumatism which is very common among people who do this work. She will use the proceeds to buy supplies, and tables and chairs so she can sell more comfortably and offer good service to her customers. Her wish for her business is to have a more varied and larger menu so she can sell more and better products and thus get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy work materials, and maintain and repair her stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ana Mayela

texts.es:
Ana, ha optado por un nuevo crédito que invertirá en la comprara flores (naturales y artificiales), espuma floral, alambre, y otros artículos necesarios en el hogar. Con esto tendrá surtido el negocio  y podar satisfacer a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior ella mejoro el negocio, tuvo mayores ventas, su economía mejoro y ha podido ir cancelando sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Ana has chosen to get another loan which she will invest in the purchase of flowers (natural and artificial), floral foam, wire, and other articles needed in the house. With this she will have her business supplied and be able to satisfy her clients.

With the previous loan, she improved her business, she had higher sales, her finance improved, and she was able to pay off her debts.

loans.use: to purchase flowers (natural and artificial), floral foam, wire, and other articles.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is from Sisian city. He is married with a 12-year-old son and lives with his family and his mother. He runs an agricultural business, and along with that, he is also a taxi driver. 

Murad has already taken out a loan from Kiva lenders and used it to repair his greenhouse and improve the household’s economy. He is very grateful and touched by such kind support and is eager to continue working with Kiva lenders. This time he is requesting a loan to repair his vehicle and purchase new tires. Realizing that driving a taxi gives him a good opportunity to sustain his family's living, this loan is very important. 

Murad has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Murad who has good credit payments behind him.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs and new tires.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz, es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, tiene 52 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Hace 10 años inicio su negocio con una pequeña variedad de mercadería. Poco a poco sus clientes pedían más cosas y entonces amplio la oferta de productos que vendía. Solicita un crédito para comprar: cosméticos, ropa, zapatos, entre otros, con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de los clientes. Estima que este crédito le ayudará salir adelante con su negocio y obtener buenos ingresos. Su plan futuro es ampliar la gama de mercadería  para ofrecer y abarcar más el mercado.
texts.en:
Luz, a native from the city of Estelí, is 52 years old, married and the mother of one son. She is a merchant by trade, she makes her living at the small grocery store. 10 years ago, she started her business with a small variety of merchandise. Little by little, her clients ordered more things and therefore she increased the offering of products she sold.

She is applying for a loan to buy: cosmetics, clothes, shoes, among others, with the objective of satisfying the demand of the customers. She estimates that this loan will help her get ahead with her business and obtain good income. Her future plan is to increase the gamut of merchandise offered and to encompass more of the market.

loans.use: to buy: cosmetics, clothes, shoes, among others.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla, es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, tiene 30 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro comprar un maniquí y más ropa para cumplir con los demandas de sus clientes. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar ropa como: pantalones, blusas, camisa, pacas de ropa usada, entre otros, con el fin de ofrecerles a su clientela una variedad de ropa más amplia. Estima que este crédito le ayudara aumentar sus ventas y así seguir adelante.
texts.en: Karla, 30, was born in Estelí and is a merchant who runs a small retail store. She is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito, as she has been able to buy a mannequin and more clothing to meet customer demand. She has applied for a new loan to buy clothing such as pants, blouses, shirts, and bulk used clothing to offer her customers more variety. She expects to increase sales and keep doing well with this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants, blouses, shirts, and bulk used clothing.

loans.name: Chinar

texts.ru: Чинар 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 дочерей и 1 сына, супруг-пенсионер. У Чинар - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чинар занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чинар и активной помощи ее детей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 3 теленка, 40 овец, 1 лошадь, а также имеет земельный надел мерою 4,80 ГА на котором выращивают фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. Каждый год получают хороший урожай, в связи с тем что у Чинар очень большой опыт в полеводстве. Она днем и ночью не покладая рук работает на своем поле с целью улучшить благосостояние своей семьи. В год два раз проводит ветеринарные работы для своих домашних животных. Также Чинар со своими детьми заготавливают корма и сено на зимний период. В общем у Чинар есть все самые необходимые условия для содержания скота. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чинар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чинар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Chinar is 40 years old, and is raising three daughters and a son with her husband. Chinar's husband is now retired. Chinar herself has a high-school degree and manages the family farm, which is their main source of income. The farm was started 20 years ago with a purchase of a cow with 2,000 som (KGS). Chinar's hard work and the help of her children have grown the farm and the family now owns 5 milk cows, 3 calves, 40 sheep, 1 horse and 12 acres of land where they grow beans, potatoes and hay. Every year the family collects an abundant harvest because Chinar has a lot of experience growing crops. She takes care of her fields day and night so that she can improve the financial lot of her family. Chinar also has a veterinarian examine her animals twice a year and puts up all the hay and feed for her livestock together with her children.  In summary, Chinar has all the facilities and equipment to take care of livestock. The monthly income from the farm is 8,000 som (KGS). In order to further expand her herd, Chinar has turned to the micro-finance bank "Bai Tushum and partners" for a loan which she will use to buy more sheep. She will use the profits from the loan to buy more livestock and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Joash's Group

texts.en:
In Chimusien village in Vihiga, Kenya, Joash has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Joash is a friendly, goal-oriented, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, well-known and well-liked member of the community with 6 children. Joash lives with his family in a house made of concrete walls, concrete floor, and an iron roof.

Chimusien village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Joash and the 20 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Joash has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Joash volunteered to be the promoter because he is willing to serve the community and he wants to help the community by killing bacteria thus making the drinking water safe. There are also three other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Samson, Emily, and Escah.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Joash’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Sophiko

texts.en:
Sophiko is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in Kutaisi district. Her husband works physically and this is the only source of income for the family.

Sophiko decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $1,000 to start a trading business. She will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and will resell at higher prices. This will increase the income of their family and with increased income, they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar, age 27, is from the village of Sarpi. He is married with two children and lives with his in-laws. His mother-in-law works as a cook and his father-in-law is a mini-bus driver. They get monthly salaries and work hard to cover food and daily expenses.
 
In order to generate income, Eldar plans to start his own business. With the loan amount, he will purchase a mini-bus which he will use to start working a bus line. He will transport passengers from his district to neighboring towns and earn daily income. Eldar hopes this family initiative will be lucrative and increase his funds. 

He is a very enthusiastic young man who wishes to be financially independent and not depending on others' incomes. Eldar and his family members are awaiting your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a mini-bus and start working a bus line.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is a 51-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her daughter and pensioner mother-in-law. Gulnara is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has 2 cows whose milk is used to make cheese products. She milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. In addition she has a small plot of land where she decided to build a shed and raise chicks. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,200 Gel to purchase building materials. Once the shed is built, she will purchase chicks and raise them and start a poultry business. The Start Up program will be a great support for her family.

loans.use: to build a shed for chicks.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia lives at home with her husband and four children. She is a high school graduate - 12th grade. For the past five years she has been selling rice, oil, pepper, etc. in the local market. She established the business with a loan from her husband. 

She encounters few problems in her business other than sometimes her customers do not have enough money, so sometimes they buy on credit. She enjoys the independence her income gives her. She is asking for a loan to buy more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Estar

texts.en:
Estar lives in Mariakani area near Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and blessed with four children that she takes care of. She is also a business lady and she has been in business for the more than three years. She is a tomato supplier. She learned of Milango through friends who asked her to join so that she can access funding for her business. The major challenges that she faces in the business are the bad debts and competition from other traders. 

She now seeks a loan to buy thirty crates of tomatoes to supply her customers. She has a vision of opening a cereals shop in the future. She will use the income that she will raise to expand her tomato business.

loans.use: to buy thirty crates of tomatoes.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia, age 38, is from the village of Likhauri where she lives with her husband and two children. She is actively involved in an agricultural business and cultivates a piece of land where maize is grown. Natia sells her produce locally. Besides that, she breeds a milk cow and a calf. Natia makes cheese in the grazing season, when her cow milks well and then she sells products from her house. 

In order to meet her increasing family expenses, Natia decided to start new business. Natia has noticed a high demand for used clothing in the market as local people can’t afford to buy new clothing due to their poverty. In response to the local market demand, she has requested a loan to purchase a stock of used clothing and household items such as towels, linens and other items to sell among her community members with a price mark-up. She plans to invest the profit in the same business and develop it in the future. Natia hopes this loan will change her life.

loans.use: to buy a stock of used clothing and household items for resale.

loans.name: Mehrun  Nisa

texts.en:
Mehrun Nisa is a 33-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for three years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When she was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family, due to limited resources none of their four children was sent to school. She felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. 

By this time, she has attained regular list of customers but now she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. With this loan amount she will be able to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of laces and zippers in different colors. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of laces and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Dar Al Hanan Group

texts.en:
Dania is the featured borrower of the Dar Al Hanan group. She came to acquire a loan with the other group members from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been family and friends.

Dania is a 25-year-old single lady who works as a tutor to make her living and cover her needs as well as her family's needs. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to provide her family with the necessary diesel fuel to warm up during the coming winter season.

She is very happy that she is able to support her family in any way, and she hopes that she will stay capable of doing so. She is the first lady from the right side of the picture wearing a veil covering her head and a long beige jacket.

As for the other group members, Lina is the lady at the center of the picture with a light pink jacket, and Haifa is the first on the left, wearing a black top.

loans.use: To provide her family with the necessary diesel fuel to warm up during the coming winter season.

loans.name: Rouba

texts.en:
Rouba is a 20-year-old single lady who's been the sole breadwinner for three members of her family for two years.

Rouba is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with newly released mobile phone accessories and phones.

Rouba is very anxious about this loan, and is working hard to keep on developing and expanding her business, to make sure that she'll stay capable of replying to her family and customers' needs.

She also provides International and local call services which is an additional income that supports her current job too.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with newly-released mobile phone accessories and phones.

loans.name: Dúo Joyas Valiosas Group

texts.es:
Dúo joyas valiosas

Este dúo está conformado por doña  Marta julia  de 43 años de edad posee una tienda de consumo diario la cual tiene bien surtida pero ella quiere comprar más productos  para tener su tienda bien  surtida y ofrecerles mejor servicio a sus clientes y por eso solicita el crédito. ella agradece a fape y kiva el apoyo que le han  brindado para poder salir adelante y poder superarse. se compromete a seguir siendo responsables en sus pagos, ya que es la forma de pagarles con bien a kiva por su ayuda.
texts.en: Marta Julia is 43 years old and is a member of the “Precious Jewels” duo. She has a store that sells household staples. She says that she keeps the store well stocked, but that she is requesting this loan to buy more products so that she can better serve her customers. Marta Julia says that she is grateful to the field partner and to Kiva for the support they have given her, so that she can get ahead in life and better herself. She says that she promises to make her payments responsibly, because that is the way to pay Kiva back for the help it has given her.

loans.use: to buy household staples to sell in her store.

loans.name: Bastagul

texts.en:
Bastagul is 44 years old and married with 4 children. Being a responsible mother, Bastagul works hard every day to generate income so that she can cover her daily costs and send some of her children to school. She is dedicated to her farming business, growing rice on her own land. In order to contribute to improving her family's living standards, she has worked hard from early morning till late evening for 15 years.

She would like to develop her business, which is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. She hopes that KIVA lenders won’t reject her loan, and she thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy seeds for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Vedasto

texts.en:
This is Vedasto, 52, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Cecilia, an employee, and they have children. He, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Vedasto operates a pineapple growing farm. He grows pineapple in their farm located in Cavite, in the highlands where the soil is suited to grow pineapple. He sells his product to the market and fruit stores that he regularly supplies and to the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php1,000 in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for his business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of his farm. 

Vedasto dreams that his business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and other supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon has a mechanical engineering workshop in Kitengela town where he does welding and metal fabrication. He is 47 years old, married and together with his spouse, has four children. He has been in this business for 14 years and it has been profitable.

He will use the loan to buy more workshop supplies such as metal sheets, electrical appliances and accessories. He will use the anticipated profits to open another workshop.

This is his third loan term and he paid his previous loans successfully. He hopes to put up a big permanent workshop.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, coffee and sugar among others.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 57 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the roofing business for 12 years and also earns an income from a general store. Sherlita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of nipa to sell.

loans.name: Sefroza

texts.en:
Sefroza is a 52-year-old hardworking woman with 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling fresh foods alongside operating a general merchandise shop. She started this business to raise money to meet her family's basic needs, since farming is seasonal and its outputs unpredictable. 

She is mainly faced with the challenges of unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations, while her dreams are to build a good residential house and own a food store that can sustainably supply her customers all year round. Sefroza is requesting a loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary lives in Senende village in Vihiga, Kenya with her husband and 7 children. The community of Senende village collects their drinking water from an unprotected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of Vihiga Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Senende’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Senende, 15 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Mary has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. Two other volunteer promoters (Joan and Henry) from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan.

Senende village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Mary believes that the dispenser will provide safe water that will help prevent waterborne diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Mary’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three members and the leader is Elizabeth, who makes a living selling designed beads from the wholesale market in the city of Accra-Teshie. This is her fifth loan with the organization, and Elizabeth (standing the middle of the photo) is going to use this loan amount of GHS 1,000 to buy different designs of beads to restock her business, so that she can offer her customers a variety of products. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Elizabeth is a very hardworking person, and she is grateful for the opportunity provided, because this loan will allow her to grow her business. She is a 28-year-old single mother of two children. 

She and her colleagues need GHS 2,700 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy different designs of beads to restock her business, so that she can offer her customers a variety of products.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi has been involved in retail business for a year already. From a rented store in one of the open local markets, Varduhi has been selling fruits and vegetables. She is married and has a little daughter. This business helps Varduhi assist her husband in sustaining the family. 

Now applying for this loan, Varduhi asks financial support for being able to purchase vegetables. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Varduhi to be able to purchase a new stock of vegetables and increase her sales. 

Varduhi waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en:
Gladys' group consists of trading women. These women are, on average 33 years old, and have children. They all live in extended traditional families in the neighborhood of Teshie, in the greater Accra region of Ghana. The members of the group know one another through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They sell cosmetics, kenkey (cooked maize flour) and fish. They are on their fifth group loan with ID-Ghana. 

Gladys is 36 years old and she sells cosmetics. She is planning to buy more cosmetics to sell. She will resell her merchandise to both men and women. Gladys expects to make an average monthly profit of GHS 100, which will be used to meet the needs of her family. A portion of her profits will also be reinvested in her business. The group needs a total of GHS 2,050 to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham lives in Ayntap village, Ararat region. He lives with his parents who are have a retirement pension. Over the last three years, Gegham has been involved in the installation of internet connectivity. Over the past 15 years Gegham has also been engaged in repair and customization of computer systems. Due to the fact that Gegham has a good experience in this field and is very hardworking, people value the service that he provides. 

Now, in order to be able to purchase internet equipments and facilities for providing internet connectivity installation services, Gegham needs financial support. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist this young man to continue his business and provide people high quality internet connectivity.

loans.use: to pay for internet equipment and facilities to provide internet connectivity installation services.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome lives in Mariakani area near Mombasa, Kenya. She is 37 years old and is married with two children under her care. She is also a business lady and she owns a retail shop. She also owns a beauty salon that generates extra income for her. 

She heard of Milango through friends who asked her to join them so that they could save and be able to access funding for their business. She now seeks a loan to buy sugar, rice and cooking oil for sale in her retail shop. The challenges that she faces in the business include competition and bad debts. The income that she will raise will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been in a beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers day by day. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. This is why she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is in her 8th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en:
Anwer is a 46-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers.

For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors. It will help her to stitch more dresses in less time. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Toraim

texts.ru: Тораим 47 лет, вдова, одна воспитывает 5 детей. После смерти мужа, Тораим потеряла главного кормильца ее большой семьи. И посовещавшись со своими детьми, решила отправить старшего сына вместе с его супругой в Россию на заработки. Сын и невестка работают и живут в России, ежемесячно высылают часть своих заработанных денег семье в Кыргызстан. Остальные дети проживают с Тораим и помогают по хозяйству. У Тораим - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Тораим занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Тораим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 дойных коров. Тораим сама доит коров, а дочери помогают ей в этом. Молоко они сдают реализаторам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тораим обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку одной коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Тораим планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение благосостояния своей семьи.
texts.en: Toraim is a 47 year old widow and is raising her five children alone. After the death of her husband Toraim's family lost their main provider. After asking her children for advice, Toraim agreed to send her eldest son and his wife to Russia for work. Her son and daughter-in-law live and work in Russia and send a part of their earning back to the family every month. The rest of the children still live with Toraim and help around the house. Toraim has a high school degree and she manages dairy business, which is the main source of income for the family.  The dairy business was started 18 years ago with a purchase of a cow with 8,000 som (KGS). Toraim's hard work has grown the herd and the family now owns 8 milk cows. Toraim and her daughters milk all the cows and sell the milk. The monthly income from the farm is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further expand her herd, Toraim has turned to the micro-finance bank "Bai Tushum and partners" for a loan which she will use to buy another milk cow. She will use the profits from the loan to buy more livestock and save money to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Kanyshay

texts.ru: Канышай 47 лет, замужем, мать -героиня, многодетная мама шестерых детей. Супруг работает специалистом в сельской управе. У самой Канышай - высшее образование, работает в местной школе преподавателем. Имеет большой авторитет среди сельчан. Канышай обучила не одно поколение детей, из которых многие сейчас работают: врачами, преподавателями, экономистами, поварами. Ученики, которые проучились у Канышай отзываются о ней как об умном, справедливом, глубоко мыслящим и идейным человеком. Она и сейчас обучает очень большое количество школьников. Свою преподавательскую работа она очень любит. К сожалению зарплаты преподавателя недостаточно чтобы прокормить семью и Канышай в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Канышай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 15 овец, также имеет небольшой земельный надел, на котором выращивают подсолнух. Осенью собрав неплохой урожай подсолнуха Канышай отвозит его на переработку и получает уже готовое подсолнечное масло для собственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Канышай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Канышай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kanyshay is 47 years old and married. She is "Mother Hero", as she is raising six children. Her husband works as a specialist at the farming co-op's office. Kanyshay herself has a college degree and works as a teacher in the local school. She is liked and respected by other villagers. Kanyshay has educated many generations of children and some of them have become doctors, teachers, economists and chefs. Her students say that she is a smart and fair teacher and a thoughtful and idealistic human being. Even now Kanyshay is teaching many students because she loves her work. Unfortunately the salary of a teacher is not enough to feed her family and Kanyshay is earning additional income by raising livestock and farming. She started 20 years ago by buying livestock with 8,000 som KGS. Kanyshay's hard work has grown the farm to include 6 milk cows, 15 sheep and a small plot of land where she grows sunflowers. Every fall Kanyshay takes her harvest to a pressing plant and has own sunflower seed oil for family's consumption. The monthly income from the livestock is 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to further expand her herd, Kanyshay has turned to the micro-finance bank "Bai Tushum and partners" for a loan which she will use to buy more cattle. She will use the profits from the loan to continue expanding the herd and save money to repair the family's home.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 47 years old, has 4 sons, and lives in Gamgeni village in Vihiga, Kenya. Gamgeni village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Rose and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Rose works as a subsistence/peasant farmer who grows primarily maize and bananas. She is already active in a community women's group, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Rose and other promoters in her community (including Leah, John and Fred) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Rose will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Rose wants to be a promoter because she is passionate about keeping her community healthy. Rose believes that the dispenser will to protect them against water-borne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Rose’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary lives in a home made of concrete walls, concrete floor, and an iron roof in Chebunaywa village in Vihiga, Kenya with her family. She is 42 years old and has a son and 4 daughters. The community of Chebunaywa village collects their drinking water from an unprotected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of Vihiga Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Chebunaywa’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Chebunaywa, 66 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Mary has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are three other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Felix, Erick and Nancy.

Chebunaywa village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Mary believes that the dispenser will prevent diseases and keep the community healthy and able to work hard to create wealth. She looks forward to her neighbors not having to spend a lot of time and money in the hospital so they can spend time and money on other important uses. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Mary’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Julias' Group

texts.en:
Julias lives in a house made of mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof in Musunji village in Vihiga, Kenya with his family. He is 49 years old and has 8 children. The community of Musunji village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of Vihiga Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Musunji’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Musunji, 15 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Julias has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are two other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Isaiah and Emmy.

Musunji village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Julias believes that the dispenser will promote good health. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Julias’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Samwel's Group

texts.en:
Samwel is 40 years old, has 5 children, and lives in Madidi village in Vihiga, Kenya. Madidi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Samwel and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Samwel works as a subsistence maize farmer, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Samwel and other promoters in her community (including Hezron, Boaz, and Flodah) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Samwel will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Samwel wants to be a promoter because his community has suffered a lot from ignorance and he sees it as his duty to sensitize them on safe water, and he gets blessings from such voluntary work.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Samwel's community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Sanatullo

texts.en:
Sanatullo is hardworking man. He was born in the year 1974. He is married and has three children. Sanatullo lives with his family in a rural area. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than three years. He fattens cows and sheep. He developed his business year by year. Sanatullo is the main food-provider in his family as his wife is a house-wife and his children are non-adults. 

Sunatullo must develop the business and maximize profits as his children demand more money. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy cattle and also he must build a cowshed for his cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle and to build a cowshed.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз умная женщина с высшим образованием. Она родилась в 1985 года. Дилафруз не замужем и живет с родителями. Дилафруз после окончания Педагогического университета начала работать в местной школе. Она преподает младшим классам. Дилафруз работает с удовольствием, так как ей очень нравится учить детей. Она старается к новшеству, всегда старается проводить свои уроки по новым методам и дать максимум знаний своим ученикам. Дилафруз планирует отремонтировать их дом, так как их дом имеет плохое состояние. Дилафруз не имеет достаточно денег для покупки строительных материалов. Ее зарплата маленькая. С целью покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома, она обратилась в ИМОН за займом в сумме 2000 сомони. Дилафруз является повторной клиенткой ИМОНа и имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilafruz is a smart woman with a college degree. She was born in 1985. She is not married and lives with her parents. After graduating from the Pedagogical University she started to work at the local school. Dilafruz is an elementary school teacher and loves her works, as she enjoys teaching young children. Dilafruz always tries to improve her teaching skills and incorporates new teaching methods so that her students learn and retain the information they learned. Dilafruz plans to repair her house, as it is in a bad state. She doesn't have enough money saved to finance all of the repairs, as a teacher's salary is very modest. In order to buy construction supplies for house repairs, Dilafruz has turned to IMON for a loan of 2000 somoni. Dilafruz is a repeated client with IMON and has a good credit history. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Sheraly

texts.ru: Шерали заботливый отец и любимый муж. Ему 28 лет. Он живет вместе со своей семьей на юге Таджикистана. Шерали 4 года назад начал свой бизнес. Он покупает оптом ткани, раздает портнихам, портнихи шьют национальные платья, а он продает национальные платья на местном рынке. Он имеет свою торговую точку на местном рынке. Шерали каждый сезон обновляет свой товар, так как его товар должен быть конкурентоспособным. Его жена помогает ему введению бизнеса. Шерали должен обновить товар, но он не имеет денег. Шерали запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки ткани для нового сезона. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sheraly is a caring father and a loving husband. He is 28 years old and lives with his family in southern Tajikistan. Sheraly has started his business four years ago. He purchases fabrics wholesale, distributes them among seamstresses who make traditional Tajik dresses from home. Sheraly then sells the dresses at the local market from his own market stall. Every season Sheraly changes the inventory of dresses he has for sale to keep his store competitive. His wife helps Sheraly in this business. Now, with the fall and winter season upon us, Sheraly needs to refresh his inventory but he doesn't have money for a wholesale purchase of fabrics. Sheraly has turned to KIVA for a loan of 3000 somoni which he will use to buy fabrics. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy new fabrics for the fall retail season

loans.name: Mahmadabror

texts.ru:
Махмадаброр родился в 1963 году в городке Норак. Махмадаброр женат. Он проживает с женой. Махмадаброр является отцом четверых детей. Его дети учатся в школе. 
Махмадаброр почти всю свою жизнь занимается животноводством. В детстве он с отцом каждое утро отправлял скот на пастбище. Сегодня Махмадаброр разводит скот самостоятельно. Он продолжает дело своего отца и дедушки. Его сыновья помогают ему в его деятельности. Животноводство является основным источником дохода в его семье. На сегодняшний день он разводит у себя дома коз и овец. Махмадаброр берет кредит с целью закупить телят и корову. Он хочет также разводить крупнорогатый скот, так как можно получить больше прибыли от продажи крупнорогатого скота. К тому же его дети выросли, он хочет чтобы они поступили в ВУЗ.
texts.en: Mahmadabror was born in 1963 in the city of Norak. He is married and lives with his wife and their four children, who are in school. He has raised farm animals for nearly his entire life. When he was a child he helped his father send cattle to pasture every morning. Now Mahmadabror raises cattle on his own, continuing the work of his father and grandfather. His sons help him with the work. The family's main source of income comes from breeding goats and sheep. Mahmadabror wants to start raising cattle because they are more profitable, so he is taking out a loan to buy calves and cows. He wants his children to be able to go to university when they grow up.

loans.use: to buy calves and cows so that his children can go to university in the future

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
This is Nilo. He previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase spare parts and pay for maintenance of his jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. He also has a farm which is also helping in generating income.
 
He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. He will be using the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Nilo hopes to have additional jeepney and dreams that his farm will continue to expand. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза молодая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 24 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Дилноза после окончания средней школы не смогла поступить в университет и таким образом она осталась без высшего образования. Данное время Дилноза работает уборщицей в средней школе. Ее мать тоже является уборщицей в той же школе. Они вместе работает. Дилноза мечтает в будущем поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. Дилноза с детства всегда хотела жить в красивом доме, но ее родители были бедными, они не имели возможности отремонтировать их дом. Теперь Дилноза планирует сама отремонтировать дом. С такой целью она обратилась за займом. Дилноза запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки цемент, древесины и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilnoza is a young and goal-oriented 24 year old woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. After finishing high school Dilnoza was not accepted to the university, so she has no college degree. Currently, she works as a cleaning lady in a school. Her mother is also a cleaning lady at the same school. They work together. Dilnoza dreams of getting accepted to college so that she can earn a college diploma. Since her childhood Dilnoza wanted to live in a beautiful house, but her parents are poor and they could never save enough to repair it. Now Dilnoza plans to pay for the repairs herself. For this reason she is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni which she will use to purchase cement, lumber and other building supplies. Dilnoza hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and lumber for repairing her house

loans.name: Jenelen

texts.en:
Jenelen is 39 years old and has four children, three of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Jenelen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a widowed woman who has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanalima has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Maribel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and pay maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay maintenance for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 35-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for years and he started the business in order to raise money to meet his family's basic needs. Customers failing to pay and price fluctuation pose a challenge to his business growth while his dreams are to buy land and make a good farm. 

Wilson intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as maize flour, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as maize flour, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a 40-year-old married woman from the Philippines. She and her husband have two children. Her children are currently in school.

Faustina is in the agricultural business. Specifically, she raises pigs for a living. She has been in this line of business for 15 years.

Faustina is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She explains that she has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Faustina would like to save enough money so that she can send her children to college. She thanks lenders for their support.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with two children. Both of her children currently attend school. She lives with her family in their house, which has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has been operating a beauty salon business. Her customers are neighbors and others in her town. She dreams of expanding her business into a beauty training school.

With the loan proceeds that she is requesting she wants to purchase hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoo. She joined Yehu because of its favorable loaning requirements.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoo

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, se ha decidido por otro crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de abono, plaguicidas, insecticidas y semilla, para tener los materiales necesarios que le faciliten la preparación del terreno para sembrar maíz y frijol.
El préstamo anterior le facilito la compra de insumos agrícolas, con lo que tuvo mejores ventas, una cosecha abundante y mejores ingresos; con los cuales ha cancelado deudas, aporto más para los gastos de su hogar y amplió su vivienda
texts.en:
Manuel has decided to take another loan which he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer, pest-control substance, insecticide and seeds to have the necessary material that will help him prepare the land to plant corn and beans.

The previous loan allowed him to purchase agricultural supplies with which he had higher sales, an abundant harvest and better revenues. This has allowed him to pay off his debts, contribute more to the household expenses and expand his house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pest-control substance, insecticide and seeds.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José, tiene 49 años de edad, es casado tiene dos hijos de 22 y 17 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos, se dedica a sembrar hortalizas como tomate, chile y ejote, pepino y pipián; además siembra granos básicos como maíz y frijol, su padre le enseño a desempeñar esta actividad y la ejerce desde que era un niño. Por su experiencia en el área ha podido administrar muy bien el negocio.
Invertirá en compra de semilla de tomate, pepino, ejote, abono plaguicidas y fertilizantes, espera aumentar el área de cultivo, incrementar la producción, aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos con los que cancelara las cuotas y dará mejora alimentación, salud y vestuario a su familia.
Sueña con tener un negocio muchos grande, enseñar a sus hijos a trabar en este rubro y aumentar la clase de productos que siembra.
texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old, married, and has two children, ages 22 and 17. He lives with his wife and children, and works growing vegetables such as tomatoes, chilies, green beans, cucumbers and squash, as well as basic grains such as corn and beans. He says that his father taught him how to farm, and that he has farmed since he was a small boy. He says that he has been able to manage the business well, because of his experience in this area.

Jose is requesting this loan to buy seeds for tomatoes, cucumbers and green beans, and to buy manure, pesticides and fertilizers. He hopes to increase the amount of land he has under cultivation, as well as increase his production, sales and income. He plans to use the income to make payments on the loan and to improve his family’s diet, health and clothing.

Jose’s dream is to have a larger business, to teach his children to work in this area and to grow a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to buy seeds for tomatoes, cucumbers, and green beans, and to buy manure, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman aged forty years with seven children all attending different schools in different areas. She lives in Kyotera town with her family and her mother whom she supports because of her advanced age. She owns a boutique where she sells all types of ladies’ wear and also has rentals which she considers as her side business. She stared her business in 1998.

She works 7 days a week and 14 hours per day and started her business to earn a living and get money to improve her standard of living. She has acquired this loan to complete construction of her rentals and her clients are ladies from Kyotera town.

Her future hopes are to enlarge her boutique and to construct more rentals and she faces the challenge of price fluctuation. She describes herself as an honest and hardworking woman who encourages lenders to continue helping business people.

loans.use: To complete construction of her rental properties.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 51-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children, and she is motivated to provide her family with quality food and clothing and to make sure that they are all healthy.

To earn a living, she has been running a small general store with her husband out of their house. She has three years of experience in this field. Her husband purchases stocks of goods from the market because he has developed many contacts over the years.

She is now hoping to grow her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet her customers' increasing demands. She is expecting a boost in her earnings as a result of the loan, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages)

loans.name: Hafeez

texts.en: Hafeez is a 40-year-old vigorous lady.  She has been stitching clothes from the past seven years. She stitches clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  For this reason, she requested a Murabaha loan of Rs 25,000 to the Kashf Foundation. She utilized this loan amount to purchase more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It allowed her to stitch up more dresses on time. She wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to allow her to stitch up more dresses on time for her customers.

loans.name: Naftal's Group

texts.en:
Naftal is 50 years old, has 3 children, and lives in Jivudavaji village in Vihiga, Kenya. Jivudavaji village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Naftal and his family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Naftal works as a subsistence/peasant farmer, but has also volunteered his time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables his community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Naftal and other promoters in his community (including Bernadett, Rose, Francis and Linet) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Naftal will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Naftal wants to be a promoter because he cares for the environment and the well-being of the community. Naftal believes that the dispenser will prevent waterborne diseases by dispenser use, leading to improved lifestyles.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Naftal’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Consolata's Group

texts.en:
Consolata lives with her family in a home with mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof in Isukura B village in Vihiga, Kenya. She is 30 years old and has 3 daughters. The community of Isukura B village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of Vihiga Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Isukura B’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Isukura B, 30 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Consolata has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Ann, Christine, Margaret and Pamela.

Isukura B village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Consolata believes that the dispenser will help the community access safe water and avoid diseases. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Consolata’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.name: Tehseen

texts.en:
Tehseen is a 28-year-old married woman living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a very hardworking and responsible housewife, who always helps her husband run their grocery store.

For many years, her husband has been running a grocery store, which is the only source of income for their family. Currently, he needs to purchase books, stationary, and other groceries for next year to continue to operate the store. But due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult to do so.

As a result, Tehseen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is confident that the loan proceeds will not only help her husband to expand his business but will also increase their net income and savings. Her goal is to provide quality education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's grocery store by purchasing books, stationery, and other grocery items
